additive-symbols.name: additive-symbols
additive-symbols.desc: @counter-style descriptor. Specifies the symbols used by the marker-construction algorithm specified by the system descriptor. Needs to be specified if the counter system is 'additive'.

align-content.name: align-content
align-content.desc: Specifies the alignment between the lines inside a flexible container when the items do not use all available space

values.name: center
values.desc: Lines are packed toward the center of the flex container.

values.name: flex-end
values.desc: Lines are packed toward the end of the flex container.

values.name: flex-start
values.desc: Lines are packed toward the start of the flex container.

values.name: space-around
values.desc: Lines are evenly distributed in the flex container, with half-size spaces on either end.

values.name: space-between
values.desc: Lines are evenly distributed in the flex container.

values.name: stretch
values.desc: Lines stretch to take up the remaining space.

values.name: start
values.desc: The items are packed flush to each other toward the start edge of the alignment container in the cross axis.

values.name: end
values.desc: The items are packed flush to each other toward the end edge of the alignment container in the cross axis.

values.name: normal
values.desc: The items are packed in their default position as if no align-content value was set.

values.name: baseline
values.desc: Specifies participation in first- or last-baseline alignment: aligns the alignment baseline of the box’s first or last baseline set with the corresponding baseline in the shared first or last baseline set of all the boxes in its baseline-sharing group. The fallback alignment for first baseline is start, the one for last baseline is end.

values.name: space-evenly
values.desc: The items are evenly distributed within the alignment container along the cross axis. The spacing between each pair of adjacent items, the main-start edge and the first item, and the main-end edge and the last item, are all exactly the same.

values.name: safe
values.desc: Used alongside an alignment keyword. If the chosen keyword means that the item overflows the alignment container causing data loss, the item is instead aligned as if the alignment mode were start.

values.name: unsafe
values.desc: Used alongside an alignment keyword. Regardless of the relative sizes of the item and alignment container and whether overflow which causes data loss might happen, the given alignment value is honored.

align-items.name: align-items
align-items.desc: Specifies the alignment for items inside a flexible container

values.name: baseline
values.desc: If the flex item’s inline axis is the same as the cross axis, this value is identical to 'flex-start'. Otherwise, it participates in baseline alignment.

values.name: center
values.desc: The flex item’s margin box is centered in the cross axis within the line.

values.name: flex-end
values.desc: The cross-end margin edge of the flex item is placed flush with the cross-end edge of the line.

values.name: flex-start
values.desc: The cross-start margin edge of the flex item is placed flush with the cross-start edge of the line.

values.name: stretch
values.desc: If the cross size property of the flex item computes to auto, and neither of the cross-axis margins are auto, the flex item is stretched.

values.name: normal
values.desc: The effect of this keyword is dependent of the layout mode we are in: In absolutely-positioned layouts, the keyword behaves like start on replaced absolutely-positioned boxes, and as stretch on all other absolutely-positioned boxes.In static position of absolutely-positioned layouts, the keyword behaves as stretch.For flex items, the keyword behaves as stretch.For grid items, this keyword leads to a behavior similar to the one of stretch, except for boxes with an aspect ratio or an intrinsic sizes where it behaves like start.The property doesn't apply to block-level boxes, and to table cells.

values.name: start
values.desc: The items are packed flush to each other toward the start edge of the alignment container in the appropriate axis.

values.name: end
values.desc: The items are packed flush to each other toward the end edge of the alignment container in the appropriate axis.

values.name: self-start
values.desc: The items are packed flush to the edge of the alignment container of the start side of the item, in the appropriate axis.

values.name: self-end
values.desc: The items are packed flush to the edge of the alignment container of the end side of the item, in the appropriate axis.

justify-items.name: justify-items
justify-items.desc: Defines the default justify-self for all items of the box, given them the default way of justifying each box along the appropriate axi

values.name: flex-end
values.desc: "Flex items are packed toward the end of the line."

values.name: flex-start
values.desc: "Flex items are packed toward the start of the line."

values.name: center
values.desc: The items are packed flush to each other toward the center of the of the alignment container.

values.name: stretch
values.desc: If the cross size property of the flex item computes to auto, and neither of the cross-axis margins are auto, the flex item is stretched.

values.name: safe
values.desc: If the size of the item overflows the alignment container, the item is instead aligned as if the alignment mode were start.

values.name: unsafe
values.desc: Regardless of the relative sizes of the item and alignment container, the given alignment value is honored.

justify-self.name: justify-self
justify-self.desc: Defines the way of justifying a box inside its container along the appropriate axis.

values.name: flex-end
values.desc: "Flex items are packed toward the end of the line."

values.name: flex-start
values.desc: "Flex items are packed toward the start of the line."

values.name: center
values.desc: The items are packed flush to each other toward the center of the of the alignment container.

values.name: stretch
values.desc: If the cross size property of the flex item computes to auto, and neither of the cross-axis margins are auto, the flex item is stretched.

values.name: safe
values.desc: If the size of the item overflows the alignment container, the item is instead aligned as if the alignment mode were start.

values.name: unsafe
values.desc: Regardless of the relative sizes of the item and alignment container, the given alignment value is honored.

align-self.name: align-self
align-self.desc: Specifies the alignment for selected items inside a flexible container

values.name: auto
values.desc: Computes to the value of 'align-items' on the element’s parent, or 'stretch' if the element has no parent. On absolutely positioned elements, it computes to itself.

values.name: baseline
values.desc: If the flex item’s inline axis is the same as the cross axis, this value is identical to 'flex-start'. Otherwise, it participates in baseline alignment.

values.name: center
values.desc: The flex item’s margin box is centered in the cross axis within the line.

values.name: flex-end
values.desc: The cross-end margin edge of the flex item is placed flush with the cross-end edge of the line.

values.name: flex-start
values.desc: The cross-start margin edge of the flex item is placed flush with the cross-start edge of the line.

values.name: stretch
values.desc: If the cross size property of the flex item computes to auto, and neither of the cross-axis margins are auto, the flex item is stretched.

values.name: normal
values.desc: The effect of this keyword is dependent of the layout mode we are in: In absolutely-positioned layouts, the keyword behaves like start on replaced absolutely-positioned boxes, and as stretch on all other absolutely-positioned boxes.In static position of absolutely-positioned layouts, the keyword behaves as stretch.For flex items, the keyword behaves as stretch.For grid items, this keyword leads to a behavior similar to the one of stretch, except for boxes with an aspect ratio or an intrinsic sizes where it behaves like start.The property doesn't apply to block-level boxes, and to table cells.

values.name: self-start
values.desc: Aligns the items to be flush with the edge of the alignment container corresponding to the item's start side in the cross axis.

values.name: self-end
values.desc: Aligns the items to be flush with the edge of the alignment container corresponding to the item's end side in the cross axis.

values.name: safe
values.desc: If the size of the item overflows the alignment container, the item is instead aligned as if the alignment mode were start.

values.name: unsafe
values.desc: Regardless of the relative sizes of the item and alignment container, the given alignment value is honored.

all.name: all
all.desc: Resets all properties (except unicode-bidi and direction)

values.name: initial
values.desc: Specifies that all the element's properties should be changed to their initial values.

values.name: inherit
values.desc: Specifies that all the element's properties should be changed to their inherited values.

values.name: unset
values.desc: Specifies that all the element's properties should be changed to their inherited values if they inherit by default, or to their initial values if not.

values.name: revert
values.desc: Specifies behavior that depends on the stylesheet origin to which the declaration belongs: User-agent originEquivalent to unset.User originRolls back the cascade to the user-agent level, so that the specified values are calculated as if no author-level or user-level rules were specified for the element.Author originRolls back the cascade to the user level, so that the specified values are calculated as if no author-level rules were specified for the element. For purposes of revert, the Author origin includes the Override and Animation origins.

alt.name: alt
alt.desc: Provides alternative text for assistive technology to replace the genenerated content of a ::before or ::after element.

animation.name: animation
animation.desc: A shorthand property for all the animation-* properties

values.name: both
values.desc: Both forwards and backwards fill modes are applied.

values.name: infinite
values.desc: Causes the animation to repeat forever.

values.name: none
values.desc: No animation is performed

values.name: normal
values.desc: Normal playback.

values.name: reverse
values.desc: All iterations of the animation are played in the reverse direction from the way they were specified.

animation-delay.name: animation-delay
animation-delay.desc: Specifies a delay for the start of an animation

animation-direction.name: animation-direction
animation-direction.desc: Specifies whether an animation should be played forwards, backwards or in alternate cycles

values.name: normal
values.desc: Normal playback.

values.name: reverse
values.desc: All iterations of the animation are played in the reverse direction from the way they were specified.

animation-duration.name: animation-duration
animation-duration.desc: Specifies how long an animation should take to complete one cycle

animation-fill-mode.name: animation-fill-mode
animation-fill-mode.desc: Specifies a style for the element when the animation is not playing (before it starts, after it ends, or both)

values.name: both
values.desc: Both forwards and backwards fill modes are applied.

values.name: none
values.desc: There is no change to the property value between the time the animation is applied and the time the animation begins playing or after the animation completes.

animation-iteration-count.name: animation-iteration-count
animation-iteration-count.desc: Specifies the number of times an animation should be played

values.name: infinite
values.desc: Causes the animation to repeat forever.

animation-name.name: animation-name
animation-name.desc: Specifies a name for the @keyframes animation

values.name: none
values.desc: No animation is performed

animation-play-state.name: animation-play-state
animation-play-state.desc: Specifies whether the animation is running or paused

animation-timing-function.name: animation-timing-function
animation-timing-function.desc: Specifies the speed curve of an animation

values.name: ease
values.desc: Equal to cubic-bezier(0.25, 0.1, 0.25, 1.0), the default value, increases in velocity towards the middle of the animation, slowing back down at the end.

values.name: linear
values.desc: Equal to cubic-bezier(0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 1.0), animates at an even speed.

values.name: ease-in
values.desc: Equal to cubic-bezier(0.42, 0, 1.0, 1.0), starts off slowly, with the speed of the transition of the animating properting increasing until complete.

values.name: ease-out
values.desc: Equal to cubic-bezier(0, 0, 0.58, 1.0), starts quickly, slowing down the animation continues. •

values.name: ease-in-out
values.desc: Equal to cubic-bezier(0.42, 0, 0.58, 1.0), with the animating properties slowly transitioning, speeding up, and then slowing down again.

values.name: cubic-bezier(p1, p2, p3, p4)
values.desc: An author defined cubic-bezier curve, where the p1 and p3 values must be in the range of 0 to 1.

values.name: steps(n, <jumpterm>)
values.desc: Displays an animation iteration along n stops along the transition, displaying each stop for equal lengths of time. For example, if n is 5,  there are 5 steps. Whether the animation holds temporarily at 0%, 20%, 40%, 60% and 80%, on the 20%, 40%, 60%, 80% and 100%, or makes 5 stops between the 0% and 100% along the animation, or makes 5 stops including the 0% and 100% marks (on the 0%, 25%, 50%, 75%, and 100%) depends on which of the following jump terms is used:			jump-start		Denotes a left-continuous function, so that the first jump happens when the animation begins;		jump-end		Denotes a right-continuous function, so that the last jump happens when the animation ends;		jump-none		There is no jump on either end. Instead, holding at both the 0% mark and the 100% mark, each for 1/n of the duration.		jump-both		Includes pauses at both the 0% and 100% marks, effectively adding a step during the animation iteration.		start		Same as jump-start.		end		Same as jump-end.

values.name: step-start
values.desc: Equal to steps(1, jump-start)

values.name: step-end
values.desc: Equal to steps(1, jump-end)

backface-visibility.name: backface-visibility
backface-visibility.desc: Defines whether or not the back face of an element should be visible when facing the user

values.name: hidden
values.desc: Back side is hidden.

values.name: visible
values.desc: Back side is visible.

background.name: background
background.desc: A shorthand property for all the background-* properties
background.restriction: enum, image, color, position, length, repeat, percentage, box

values.name: fixed
values.desc: The background is fixed with regard to the viewport. In paged media where there is no viewport, a 'fixed' background is fixed with respect to the page box and therefore replicated on every page.

values.name: local
values.desc: The background is fixed with regard to the element's contents: if the element has a scrolling mechanism, the background scrolls with the element's contents.

values.name: scroll
values.desc: The background is fixed with regard to the element itself and does not scroll with its contents. (It is effectively attached to the element's border.)

background-attachment.name: background-attachment
background-attachment.desc: Sets whether a background image scrolls with the rest of the page, or is fixed

values.name: fixed
values.desc: The background is fixed with regard to the viewport. In paged media where there is no viewport, a 'fixed' background is fixed with respect to the page box and therefore replicated on every page.

values.name: local
values.desc: The background is fixed with regard to the element’s contents: if the element has a scrolling mechanism, the background scrolls with the element’s contents.

values.name: scroll
values.desc: The background is fixed with regard to the element itself and does not scroll with its contents. (It is effectively attached to the element’s border.)

background-blend-mode.name: background-blend-mode
background-blend-mode.desc: Specifies the blending mode of each background layer (color/image)

values.name: normal
values.desc: Default attribute which specifies no blending

background-clip.name: background-clip
background-clip.desc: Defines how far the background (color or image) should extend within an element

values.name: border-box
values.desc: The background extends to the outside edge of the border (but underneath the border in z-ordering).

values.name: padding-box
values.desc: The background extends to the outside edge of the padding. No background is drawn beneath the border.

values.name: content-box
values.desc: The background is painted within (clipped to) the content box.

values.name: text
values.desc: The background is painted within (clipped to) the foreground text.

background-color.name: background-color
background-color.desc: Specifies the background color of an element

background-image.name: background-image
background-image.desc: Specifies one or more background images for an element

values.name: none
values.desc: Counts as an image layer but draws nothing.

background-origin.name: background-origin
background-origin.desc: Specifies the origin position of a background image

values.name: border-box
values.desc: The background is positioned relative to the border box.

values.name: padding-box
values.desc: The background is positioned relative to the padding box.

values.name: content-box
values.desc: The background is positioned relative to the content box.

background-position.name: background-position
background-position.desc: Specifies the position of a background image

background-position-x.name: background-position-x
background-position-x.desc: If background images have been specified, this property specifies their initial position (after any resizing) within their corresponding background positioning area.

values.name: center
values.desc: Equivalent to '50%' ('left 50%') for the horizontal position if the horizontal position is not otherwise specified, or '50%' ('top 50%') for the vertical position if it is.

values.name: left
values.desc: Equivalent to '0%' for the horizontal position if one or two values are given, otherwise specifies the left edge as the origin for the next offset.

values.name: right
values.desc: Equivalent to '100%' for the horizontal position if one or two values are given, otherwise specifies the right edge as the origin for the next offset.

background-position-y.name: background-position-y
background-position-y.desc: If background images have been specified, this property specifies their initial position (after any resizing) within their corresponding background positioning area.

values.name: bottom
values.desc: Equivalent to '100%' for the vertical position if one or two values are given, otherwise specifies the bottom edge as the origin for the next offset.

values.name: center
values.desc: Equivalent to '50%' ('left 50%') for the horizontal position if the horizontal position is not otherwise specified, or '50%' ('top 50%') for the vertical position if it is.

values.name: top
values.desc: Equivalent to '0%' for the vertical position if one or two values are given, otherwise specifies the top edge as the origin for the next offset.

background-repeat.name: background-repeat
background-repeat.desc: Sets if/how a background image will be repeated

background-size.name: background-size
background-size.desc: Specifies the size of the background images

values.name: auto
values.desc: Resolved by using the image’s intrinsic ratio and the size of the other dimension, or failing that, using the image’s intrinsic size, or failing that, treating it as 100%.

values.name: contain
values.desc: Scale the image, while preserving its intrinsic aspect ratio (if any), to the largest size such that both its width and its height can fit inside the background positioning area.

values.name: cover
values.desc: Scale the image, while preserving its intrinsic aspect ratio (if any), to the smallest size such that both its width and its height can completely cover the background positioning area.

behavior.name: behavior
behavior.desc: IE only. Used to extend behaviors of the browser.

values.name: auto

values.name: space

values.name: stretch
values.desc: The image is stretched to fill the area.

values.name: round

values.name: avoid-column

values.name: avoid-page
values.desc: Avoid a page break before/after the principal box.

values.name: column
values.desc: Always force a column break before/after the principal box.

values.name: left
values.desc: Force one or two page breaks before/after the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a left page.

values.name: page
values.desc: Always force a page break before/after the principal box.

values.name: right
values.desc: Force one or two page breaks before/after the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a right page.

break-before.name: break-before
break-before.desc: Specifies whether or not a page-, column-, or region-break should occur before the specified element

values.name: always
values.desc: Always force a page break before/after the generated box.

values.name: auto
values.desc: Neither force nor forbid a page/column break before/after the principal box.

values.name: avoid
values.desc: Avoid a break before/after the principal box.

values.name: avoid-column
values.desc: Avoid a column break before/after the principal box.

values.name: avoid-page
values.desc: Avoid a page break before/after the principal box.

values.name: column
values.desc: Always force a column break before/after the principal box.

values.name: left
values.desc: Force one or two page breaks before/after the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a left page.

values.name: page
values.desc: Always force a page break before/after the principal box.

values.name: right
values.desc: Force one or two page breaks before/after the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a right page.

break-inside.name: break-inside
break-inside.desc: Specifies whether or not a page-, column-, or region-break should occur inside the specified element

values.name: auto
values.desc: Impose no additional breaking constraints within the box.

values.name: avoid
values.desc: Avoid breaks within the box.

values.name: avoid-column
values.desc: Avoid a column break within the box.

values.name: avoid-page
values.desc: Avoid a page break within the box.

values.name: avoid-region
values.desc: Avoids any region break within the principal box.

caption-side.name: caption-side
caption-side.desc: Specifies the placement of a table caption

values.name: bottom
values.desc: Positions the caption box below the table box.

values.name: top
values.desc: Positions the caption box above the table box.

values.name: left
values.desc: The caption box should be positioned on the left side of the table.

values.name: right
values.desc: The caption box should be positioned on the right side of the table.

values.name: top-outside
values.desc: The caption box should be positioned above the table, while the width and horizontal alignment behavior are not bound to the table's horizontal layout.

values.name: bottom-outside
values.desc: The caption box should be positioned below the table, while the width and horizontal alignment behavior are not bound to the table's horizontal layout.

caret-color.name: caret-color
caret-color.desc: Specifies the color of the cursor (caret) in inputs, textareas, or any element that is editable

values.name: auto
values.desc: The user agent selects an appropriate color for the caret. This is generally currentcolor, but the user agent may choose a different color to ensure good visibility and contrast with the surrounding content, taking into account the value of currentcolor, the background, shadows, and other factors.

clear.name: clear
clear.desc: Specifies on which sides of an element floating elements are not allowed to float

values.name: both
values.desc: The clearance of the generated box is set to the amount necessary to place the top border edge below the bottom outer edge of any right-floating and left-floating boxes that resulted from elements earlier in the source document.

values.name: left
values.desc: The clearance of the generated box is set to the amount necessary to place the top border edge below the bottom outer edge of any left-floating boxes that resulted from elements earlier in the source document.

values.name: none
values.desc: No constraint on the box's position with respect to floats.

values.name: right
values.desc: The clearance of the generated box is set to the amount necessary to place the top border edge below the bottom outer edge of any right-floating boxes that resulted from elements earlier in the source document.

values.name: inline-start
values.desc: Is a keyword indicating that the element is moved down to clear floats on start side of its containing block, that is the left floats on ltr scripts and the right floats on rtl scripts.

values.name: inline-end
values.desc: Is a keyword indicating that the element is moved down to clear floats on end side of its containing block, that is the right floats on ltr scripts and the left floats on rtl scripts.

values.name: auto
values.desc: The element does not clip.

clip-path.name: clip-path
clip-path.desc: Specifies a clipping path where everything inside the path is visable and everything outside is clipped out.

values.name: none
values.desc: No clipping path gets created.

values.name: url()
values.desc: References a <clipPath> element to create a clipping path.

clip-rule.name: clip-rule
clip-rule.desc: Indicates the algorithm which is to be used to determine what parts of the canvas are included inside the shape.

color-interpolation-filters.name: color-interpolation-filters
color-interpolation-filters.desc: Specifies the color space for imaging operations performed via filter effects.

values.name: auto
values.desc: Color operations are not required to occur in a particular color space.

column-count.name: column-count
column-count.desc: Specifies the number of columns an element should be divided into

values.name: auto
values.desc: Determines the number of columns by the 'column-width' property and the element width.

column-fill.name: column-fill
column-fill.desc: Specifies how to fill columns, balanced or not

values.name: auto
values.desc: Fills columns sequentially.

values.name: balance-all
values.desc: Content is equally divided between columns. In fragmented contexts, such as paged media, all fragments are balanced.

column-gap.name: column-gap
column-gap.desc: Specifies the gap between the columns

values.name: normal
values.desc: User agent specific and typically equivalent to 1em.

column-rule.name: column-rule
column-rule.desc: A shorthand property for all the column-rule-* properties

column-rule-color.name: column-rule-color
column-rule-color.desc: Specifies the color of the rule between columns

column-rule-style.name: column-rule-style
column-rule-style.desc: Specifies the style of the rule between columns

column-rule-width.name: column-rule-width
column-rule-width.desc: Specifies the width of the rule between columns

columns.name: columns
columns.desc: A shorthand property for column-width and column-count

values.name: auto
values.desc: The width depends on the values of other properties.

column-span.name: column-span
column-span.desc: Specifies how many columns an element should span across

values.name: all
values.desc: The element spans across all columns. Content in the normal flow that appears before the element is automatically balanced across all columns before the element appear.

values.name: none
values.desc: The element does not span multiple columns.

values.name: auto
values.desc: The width depends on the values of other properties.

contain.name: contain
contain.desc: Indicates that an element and its contents are, as much as possible, independent of the rest of the document tree.

values.name: none
values.desc: Indicates that the property has no effect.

values.name: strict
values.desc: Turns on all forms of containment for the element.

values.name: content
values.desc: All containment rules except size are applied to the element.

values.name: style
values.desc: Turns on style containment for the element.

content.name: content
content.desc: Used with the :before and :after pseudo-elements, to insert generated content

values.name: icon
values.desc: The (pseudo-)element is replaced in its entirety by the resource referenced by its 'icon' property, and treated as a replaced element.

values.name: none
values.desc: On elements, this inhibits the children of the element from being rendered as children of this element, as if the element was empty. On pseudo-elements it causes the pseudo-element to have no content.

values.name: normal
values.desc: See http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-content/#content for computation rules.

values.name: attr(x)
values.desc: The value of the element's attribute x as a string. If there is no attribute x, an empty string is returned. The case-sensitivity of attribute names depends on the document language.

values.name: open-quote | close-quote
values.desc: These values are replaced by the appropriate string from the quotes property.

values.name: no-open-quote | no-close-quote
values.desc: Introduces no content, but increments (decrements) the level of nesting for quotes.

counter-increment.name: counter-increment
counter-increment.desc: Increases or decreases the value of one or more CSS counters

values.name: none
values.desc: This element does not alter the value of any counters.

counter-reset.name: counter-reset
counter-reset.desc: Creates or resets one or more CSS counters

values.name: none
values.desc: The counter is not modified.

cursor.name: cursor
cursor.desc: Specifies the mouse cursor to be displayed when pointing over an element

values.name: auto
values.desc: The UA determines the cursor to display based on the current context.

values.name: default
values.desc: The platform-dependent default cursor. Often rendered as an arrow.

values.name: none
values.desc: No cursor is rendered for the element.

values.name: text
values.desc: Indicates text that may be selected. Often rendered as a vertical I-beam.

values.name: Keyword values
values.desc: Move your mouse over values to see their live appearance in your browser: CategoryCSS valueExampleDescriptionGeneralautoThe UA will determine the cursor to display based on the current context. E.g., equivalent to text when hovering text.defaultThe platform-dependent default cursor. Typically an arrow.noneNo cursor is rendered.Links & statuscontext-menuA context menu is available.helpHelp information is available.pointerThe cursor is a pointer that indicates a link. Typically an image of a pointing hand.progressThe program is busy in the background, but the user can still interact with the interface (in contrast to wait).waitThe program is busy, and the user can't interact with the interface (in contrast to progress). Sometimes an image of an hourglass or a watch.SelectioncellThe table cell or set of cells can be selected.crosshairCross cursor, often used to indicate selection in a bitmap.textThe text can be selected. display.name: display
display.desc: Specifies how a certain HTML element should be displayed

values.name: contents
values.desc: The element itself does not generate any boxes, but its children and pseudo-elements still generate boxes as normal.

values.name: inline
values.desc: The element generates an inline-level box.

values.name: none
values.desc: The element and its descendants generates no boxes.

values.name: ruby
values.desc: The element generates a principal ruby container box, and establishes a ruby formatting context.

empty-cells.name: empty-cells
empty-cells.desc: Specifies whether or not to display borders and background on empty cells in a table

enable-background.name: enable-background
enable-background.desc: Deprecated. Use 'isolation' property instead when support allows. Specifies how the accumulation of the background image is managed.

fallback.name: fallback
fallback.desc: @counter-style descriptor. Specifies a fallback counter style to be used when the current counter style can’t create a representation for a given counter value.

fill.name: fill
fill.desc: Paints the interior of the given graphical element.

values.name: url()
values.desc: A URL reference to a paint server element, which is an element that defines a paint server: ‘hatch’, ‘linearGradient’, ‘mesh’, ‘pattern’, ‘radialGradient’ and ‘solidcolor’.

fill-opacity.name: fill-opacity
fill-opacity.desc: Specifies the opacity of the painting operation used to paint the interior the current object.

fill-rule.name: fill-rule
fill-rule.desc: Indicates the algorithm (or winding rule) which is to be used to determine what parts of the canvas are included inside the shape.

filter.name: filter
filter.desc: Defines effects (e.g. blurring or color shifting) on an element before the element is displayed

values.name: none
values.desc: No filter effects are applied.

values.name: url()
values.desc: A filter reference to a <filter> element.

flex.name: flex
flex.desc: A shorthand property for the flex-grow, flex-shrink, and the flex-basis properties

values.name: auto
values.desc: Retrieves the value of the main size property as the used 'flex-basis'.

values.name: content
values.desc: Indicates automatic sizing, based on the flex item’s content.

values.name: none
values.desc: Expands to '0 0 auto'.

values.name: initial
values.desc: The item is sized according to its width and height properties. It shrinks to its minimum size to fit the container, but does not grow to absorb any extra free space in the flex container. This is equivalent to setting "flex: 0 1 auto".

flex-basis.name: flex-basis
flex-basis.desc: Specifies the initial length of a flexible item

values.name: auto
values.desc: Retrieves the value of the main size property as the used 'flex-basis'.

values.name: content
values.desc: Indicates automatic sizing, based on the flex item’s content.

flex-direction.name: flex-direction
flex-direction.desc: Specifies the direction of the flexible items

values.name: column
values.desc: The flex container’s main axis has the same orientation as the block axis of the current writing mode.

values.name: row
values.desc: The flex container’s main axis has the same orientation as the inline axis of the current writing mode.

flex-flow.name: flex-flow
flex-flow.desc: A shorthand property for the flex-direction and the flex-wrap properties

values.name: column
values.desc: The flex container’s main axis has the same orientation as the block axis of the current writing mode.

values.name: nowrap
values.desc: The flex container is single-line.

values.name: row
values.desc: The flex container’s main axis has the same orientation as the inline axis of the current writing mode.

values.name: wrap
values.desc: The flexbox is multi-line.

flex-grow.name: flex-grow
flex-grow.desc: Specifies how much the item will grow relative to the rest

flex-shrink.name: flex-shrink
flex-shrink.desc: Specifies how the item will shrink relative to the rest

flex-wrap.name: flex-wrap
flex-wrap.desc: Specifies whether the flexible items should wrap or not

values.name: nowrap
values.desc: The flex container is single-line.

values.name: wrap
values.desc: The flexbox is multi-line.

float.name: float
float.desc: Specifies whether or not a box should float

values.name: left
values.desc: The element generates a block box that is floated to the left. Content flows on the right side of the box, starting at the top (subject to the 'clear' property).

values.name: none
values.desc: The box is not floated.

values.name: right
values.desc: Similar to 'left', except the box is floated to the right, and content flows on the left side of the box, starting at the top.

flood-color.name: flood-color
flood-color.desc: Indicates what color to use to flood the current filter primitive subregion.

flood-opacity.name: flood-opacity
flood-opacity.desc: Indicates what opacity to use to flood the current filter primitive subregion.

font.name: font
font.desc: A shorthand property for the font-style, font-variant, font-weight, font-size/line-height, and the font-family properties

values.name: icon
values.desc: The font used to label icons.

values.name: italic
values.desc: Selects a font that is labeled 'italic', or, if that is not available, one labeled 'oblique'.

values.name: normal
values.desc: Specifies a face that is not labeled as a small-caps font.

values.name: oblique
values.desc: Selects a font that is labeled 'oblique'.

values.name: small-caps
values.desc: Specifies a font that is labeled as a small-caps font. If a genuine small-caps font is not available, user agents should simulate a small-caps font.

font-family.name: font-family
font-family.desc: Specifies the font family for text

values.name: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif
Cambria, Cochin, Georgia, Times, Times New Roman, serif
'Gill Sans', 'Gill Sans MT', Calibri, 'Trebuchet MS', sans-serif
'Lucida Sans', 'Lucida Sans Regular', 'Lucida Grande', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', Geneva, Verdana, sans-serif
'Trebuchet MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Lucida Grande', 'Lucida Sans', Arial, sans-serif

font-feature-settings.name: font-feature-settings
font-feature-settings.desc: Allows control over advanced typographic features in OpenType fonts

values.name: "c2cs"
values.desc: Small Capitals From Capitals. Applies only to bicameral scripts.

values.name: "dlig"
values.desc: Discretionary ligatures.

values.name: "kern"
values.desc: Kerning.

values.name: "liga"
values.desc: Standard Ligatures.

values.name: "lnum"
values.desc: Lining Figures.

values.name: "onum"
values.desc: Oldstyle Figures.

values.name: "smcp"
values.desc: Small Capitals. Applies only to bicameral scripts.

values.name: "swsh"
values.desc: Swash. Does not apply to ideographic scripts.

values.name: "tnum"
values.desc: Tabular Figures.

values.name: normal
values.desc: No change in glyph substitution or positioning occurs.

values.name: off
values.desc: Disable feature.

values.name: on
values.desc: Enable feature.

font-kerning.name: font-kerning
font-kerning.desc: Controls the usage of the kerning information (how letters are spaced)

values.name: auto
values.desc: Specifies that kerning is applied at the discretion of the user agent.

values.name: none
values.desc: Specifies that kerning is not applied.

values.name: normal
values.desc: Specifies that kerning is applied.

font-language-override.name: font-language-override
font-language-override.desc: Controls the usage of language-specific glyphs in a typeface

values.name: normal
values.desc: Implies that when rendering with OpenType fonts the language of the document is used to infer the OpenType language system, used to select language specific features when rendering.

font-size.name: font-size
font-size.desc: Specifies the font size of text

values.name: xx-small, x-small, small, medium, large, x-large, xx-large, xxx-large
values.desc: Absolute-size keywords, based on the user's default font size (which is medium).

values.name: larger, smaller
values.desc: Relative-size keywords. The font will be larger or smaller relative to the parent element's font size, roughly by the ratio used to separate the absolute-size keywords above.

font-size-adjust.name: font-size-adjust
font-size-adjust.desc: Preserves the readability of text when font fallback occurs

values.name: none
values.desc: Do not preserve the font’s x-height.

font-stretch.name: font-stretch
font-stretch.desc: Selects a normal, condensed, or expanded face from a font family

values.name: semi-condensed, condensed, extra-condensed, ultra-condensed
values.desc: Specifies a more condensed font face than normal, with ultra-condensed as the most condensed.

values.name: semi-expanded, expanded, extra-expanded, ultra-expanded
values.desc: Specifies a more expanded font face than normal, with ultra-expanded as the most expanded.

font-style.name: font-style
font-style.desc: Specifies the font style for text

values.name: italic
values.desc: Selects a font that is labeled as an 'italic' face, or an 'oblique' face if one is not

values.name: normal
values.desc: Selects a face that is classified as 'normal'.

values.name: oblique
values.desc: Selects a font that is labeled as an 'oblique' face, or an 'italic' face if one is not.

values.name: oblique <angle>
values.desc: Selects a font classified as oblique, and additionally specifies an angle for the slant of the text. If one or more oblique faces are available in the chosen font family, the one that most closely matches the specified angle is chosen. If no oblique faces are available, the browser will synthesize an oblique version of the font by slanting a normal face by the specified amount. Valid values are degree values of -90deg to 90deg inclusive. If an angle is not specified, an angle of 14 degrees is used. Positive values are slanted to the end of the line, while negative values are slanted towards the beginning.  In general, for a requested angle of 14 degrees or greater, larger angles are prefered; otherwise, smaller angles are preferred (see the spec's font matching section for the precise algorithm).

font-synthesis.name: font-synthesis
font-synthesis.desc: Controls which missing typefaces (bold or italic) may be synthesized by the browser

values.name: none
values.desc: Disallow all synthetic faces.

values.name: style
values.desc: Allow synthetic italic faces.

font-variant.name: font-variant
font-variant.desc: Specifies whether or not a text should be displayed in a small-caps font

values.name: normal
values.desc: Specifies a face that is not labeled as a small-caps font.

values.name: small-caps
values.desc: Specifies a font that is labeled as a small-caps font. If a genuine small-caps font is not available, user agents should simulate a small-caps font.

values.name: none
values.desc: Sets the value of the font-variant-ligatures to none and the values of the other longhand property as normal, their initial value.

values.name: stylistic(),  historical-forms, styleset(), character-variant(), swash(), ornaments(), annotation()
values.desc: Specifies the keywords and functions related to the font-variant-alternates longhand property.

values.name: small-caps, all-small-caps, petite-caps, all-petite-caps, unicase, titling-caps
values.desc: Specifies the keywords and functions related to the font-variant-caps longhand property.

font-variant-alternates.name: font-variant-alternates
font-variant-alternates.desc: Controls the usage of alternate glyphs associated to alternative names defined in @font-feature-values

values.name: normal
values.desc: None of the features are enabled.

font-variant-caps.name: font-variant-caps
font-variant-caps.desc: Controls the usage of alternate glyphs for capital letters

values.name: normal
values.desc: None of the features are enabled.

values.name: small-caps
values.desc: Enables display of small capitals. Small-caps glyphs typically use the form of uppercase letters but are reduced to the size of lowercase letters.

font-variant-east-asian.name: font-variant-east-asian
font-variant-east-asian.desc: Controls the usage of alternate glyphs for East Asian scripts (e.g Japanese and Chinese)

values.name: normal
values.desc: None of the features are enabled.

values.name: ruby
values.desc: Enables display of ruby variant glyphs.

font-variant-ligatures.name: font-variant-ligatures
font-variant-ligatures.desc: Controls which ligatures and contextual forms are used in textual content of the elements it applies to

values.name: none
values.desc: Disables all ligatures.

values.name: normal
values.desc: Implies that the defaults set by the font are used.

font-variant-numeric.name: font-variant-numeric
font-variant-numeric.desc: Controls the usage of alternate glyphs for numbers, fractions, and ordinal markers

values.name: normal
values.desc: None of the features are enabled.

font-variant-position.name: font-variant-position
font-variant-position.desc: Controls the usage of alternate glyphs of smaller size positioned as superscript or subscript regarding the baseline of the font

values.name: normal
values.desc: None of the features are enabled.

values.name: sub
values.desc: Enables display of subscript variants (OpenType feature: subs).

values.name: super
values.desc: Enables display of superscript variants (OpenType feature: sups).

font-weight.name: font-weight
font-weight.desc: Specifies the weight of a font

values.name: normal
values.desc: Same as 400

glyph-orientation-horizontal.name: glyph-orientation-horizontal
glyph-orientation-horizontal.desc: Controls glyph orientation when the inline-progression-direction is horizontal.

glyph-orientation-vertical.name: glyph-orientation-vertical
glyph-orientation-vertical.desc: Controls glyph orientation when the inline-progression-direction is vertical.

values.name: auto
values.desc: Sets the orientation based on the fullwidth or non-fullwidth characters and the most common orientation.

grid-area.name: grid-area
grid-area.desc: Either specifies a name for the grid item, or this property is a shorthand property for the grid-row-start, grid-column-start, grid-row-end, and grid-column-end properties

values.name: auto
values.desc: The property contributes nothing to the grid item’s placement, indicating auto-placement, an automatic span, or a default span of one.

values.name: span && [ <integer> || <custom-ident> ]
values.desc: Contributes a grid span to the grid item’s placement such that the corresponding edge of the grid item’s grid area is n lines from the opposite edge. If a name is given as a <custom-ident>, only lines with that name are counted. If not enough lines with that name exist, all implicit grid lines on the side of the explicit grid corresponding to the search direction are assumed to have that name for the purpose of counting this span. If the <integer> is omitted, it defaults to 1. Negative integers or 0 are invalid.

values.name: min-content
values.desc: Represents the largest min-content contribution of the grid items occupying the grid track.

values.name: max-content
values.desc: Represents the largest max-content contribution of the grid items occupying the grid track.

values.name: auto
values.desc: As a maximum, identical to 'max-content'. As a minimum, represents the largest minimum size (as specified by min-width/min-height) of the grid items occupying the grid track.

values.name: minmax(min, max)
values.desc: Is a functional notation that defines a size range greater than or equal to min and less than or equal to max. If max is smaller than min, then max is ignored and the function is treated as min. As a maximum, a <flex> value sets the track’s flex factor. As a minimum, it is treated as zero (or minimal content, if the grid container is sized under a minimal content constraint).

values.name: fit-content(argument)
values.desc: Represents the formula min(max-content, max(auto, argument)), which is calculated similar to auto (i.e. minmax(auto, max-content)), except that the track size is clamped at argument if it is greater than the auto minimum.

grid-auto-flow.name: grid-auto-flow
grid-auto-flow.desc: Specifies how auto-placed items are inserted in the grid

values.name: row
values.desc: The auto-placement algorithm places items by filling each row in turn, adding new rows as necessary.

values.name: column
values.desc: The auto-placement algorithm places items by filling each column in turn, adding new columns as necessary.

values.name: min-content
values.desc: Represents the largest min-content contribution of the grid items occupying the grid track.

values.name: max-content
values.desc: Represents the largest max-content contribution of the grid items occupying the grid track.

values.name: auto
values.desc: As a maximum, identical to 'max-content'. As a minimum, represents the largest minimum size (as specified by min-width/min-height) of the grid items occupying the grid track.

values.name: minmax(min, max)
values.desc: Is a functional notation that defines a size range greater than or equal to min and less than or equal to max. If max is smaller than min, then max is ignored and the function is treated as min. As a maximum, a <flex> value sets the track’s flex factor. As a minimum, it is treated as zero (or minimal content, if the grid container is sized under a minimal content constraint).

grid-column.name: grid-column
grid-column.desc: A shorthand property for the grid-column-start and the grid-column-end properties

values.name: auto
values.desc: The property contributes nothing to the grid item’s placement, indicating auto-placement, an automatic span, or a default span of one.

values.name: span && [ <integer> || <custom-ident> ]
values.desc: Contributes a grid span to the grid item’s placement such that the corresponding edge of the grid item’s grid area is n lines from the opposite edge.	If a name is given as a <custom-ident>, only lines with that name are counted. If not enough lines with that name exist, all implicit grid lines on the side of the explicit grid corresponding to the search direction are assumed to have that name for the purpose of counting this span.	If the <integer> is omitted, it defaults to 1. Negative integers or 0 are invalid.

grid-column-end.name: grid-column-end
grid-column-end.desc: Specifies where to end the grid item

values.name: auto
values.desc: The property contributes nothing to the grid item’s placement, indicating auto-placement, an automatic span, or a default span of one.

values.name: span && [ <integer> || <custom-ident> ]
values.desc: Contributes a grid span to the grid item’s placement such that the column end edge of the grid item’s grid area is n lines from the start edge. If a name is given as a <custom-ident>, only lines with that name are counted. If not enough lines with that name exist, all implicit grid lines on the side of the explicit grid corresponding to the search direction are assumed to have that name for the purpose of counting this span. If the <integer> is omitted, it defaults to 1. Negative integers or 0 are invalid. The <custom-ident> cannot take the span value.

grid-column-gap.name: grid-column-gap
grid-column-gap.desc: Specifies the size of the gap between columns

values.name: normal
values.desc: The browser's default spacing is used between columns. For multi-column layout this is specified as 1em. For all other layout types it is 0.

grid-column-start.name: grid-column-start
grid-column-start.desc: Specifies where to start the grid item

values.name: auto
values.desc: The property contributes nothing to the grid item’s placement, indicating auto-placement, an automatic span, or a default span of one.

values.name: span && [ <integer> || <custom-ident> ]

If a name is given as a <custom-ident>, only lines with that name are counted. If not enough lines with that name exist, all implicit grid lines on the side of the explicit grid corresponding to the search direction are assumed to have that name for the purpose of counting this span. If the <integer> is omitted, it defaults to 1. Negative integers and 0 are invalid. The <custom-ident> cannot take the span value.

grid-template.name: grid-template
grid-template.desc: A shorthand property for the grid-template-rows, grid-template-columns and grid-areas properties

values.name: none
values.desc: Sets all three properties to their initial values.

values.name: min-content
values.desc: Represents the largest min-content contribution of the grid items occupying the grid track.

values.name: max-content
values.desc: Represents the largest max-content contribution of the grid items occupying the grid track.

values.name: auto
values.desc: As a maximum, identical to 'max-content'. As a minimum, represents the largest minimum size (as specified by min-width/min-height) of the grid items occupying the grid track.

values.name: subgrid
values.desc: Sets 'grid-template-rows' and 'grid-template-columns' to 'subgrid', and 'grid-template-areas' to its initial value.

values.name: repeat()
values.desc: Represents a repeated fragment of the track list, allowing a large number of columns or rows that exhibit a recurring pattern to be written in a more compact form.

grid-template-areas.name: grid-template-areas
grid-template-areas.desc: Specifies how to display columns and rows, using named grid items

values.name: none
values.desc: The grid container doesn’t define any named grid areas.

grid-template-columns.name: grid-template-columns
grid-template-columns.desc: Specifies the size of the columns, and how many columns in a grid layout

values.name: none
values.desc: There is no explicit grid; any rows/columns will be implicitly generated.

values.name: min-content
values.desc: Represents the largest min-content contribution of the grid items occupying the grid track.

values.name: max-content
values.desc: Represents the largest max-content contribution of the grid items occupying the grid track.

values.name: auto
values.desc: As a maximum, identical to 'max-content'. As a minimum, represents the largest minimum size (as specified by min-width/min-height) of the grid items occupying the grid track.

values.name: subgrid
values.desc: Indicates that the grid will align to its parent grid in that axis.

values.name: repeat()
values.desc: Represents a repeated fragment of the track list, allowing a large number of columns or rows that exhibit a recurring pattern to be written in a more compact form.

values.name: minmax(min, max)
values.desc: Is a functional notation that defines a size range greater than or equal to min and less than or equal to max. If max is smaller than min, then max is ignored and the function is treated as min. As a maximum, a <flex> value sets the track’s flex factor. It is invalid as a minimum.

values.name: fit-content( [ <length> | <percentage> ] )
values.desc: Represents the formula min(max-content, max(auto, argument)), which is calculated similar to auto (i.e. minmax(auto, max-content)), except that the track size is clamped at argument if it is greater than the auto minimum.

values.name: repeat( [ <positive-integer> | auto-fill | auto-fit ] , <track-list> )
values.desc: Represents a repeated fragment of the track list, allowing a large number of columns that exhibit a recurring pattern to be written in a more compact form.

grid-template-rows.name: grid-template-rows
grid-template-rows.desc: Specifies the size of the rows in a grid layout

values.name: none
values.desc: There is no explicit grid; any rows/columns will be implicitly generated.

values.name: min-content
values.desc: Represents the largest min-content contribution of the grid items occupying the grid track.

values.name: max-content
values.desc: Represents the largest max-content contribution of the grid items occupying the grid track.

values.name: auto
values.desc: As a maximum, identical to 'max-content'. As a minimum, represents the largest minimum size (as specified by min-width/min-height) of the grid items occupying the grid track.

values.name: subgrid
values.desc: Indicates that the grid will align to its parent grid in that axis.

values.name: repeat()
values.desc: Represents a repeated fragment of the track list, allowing a large number of columns or rows that exhibit a recurring pattern to be written in a more compact form.

values.name: minmax(min, max)
values.desc: Is a functional notation that defines a size range, greater than or equal to min, and less than or equal to max. If max is smaller than min, then max is ignored and the function is treated as min. As a maximum, a <flex> value sets the track’s flex factor. It is invalid as a minimum.

values.name: fit-content( [ <length> | <percentage> ] )
values.desc: Represents the formula min(max-content, max(auto, argument)), which is calculated similar to auto (i.e. minmax(auto, max-content)), except that the track size is clamped at argument if it is greater than the auto minimum.

values.name: repeat( [ <positive-integer> | auto-fill | auto-fit ] , <track-list> )
values.desc: Represents a repeated fragment of the track list, allowing a large number of rows that exhibit a recurring pattern to be written in a more compact form.

height.name: height
height.desc: Sets the height of an element

values.name: auto
values.desc: The height depends on the values of other properties.

values.name: max-content
values.desc: Use the max-content inline size or max-content block size, as appropriate to the writing mode.

values.name: min-content
values.desc: Use the min-content inline size or min-content block size, as appropriate to the writing mode.

values.name: fit-content(<length-percentage>)
values.desc: Uses the fit-content formula with the available space replaced by the specified argument, i.e. min(max-content, max(min-content, )).

hyphens.name: hyphens
hyphens.desc: Sets how to split words to improve the layout of paragraphs

values.name: auto
values.desc: Conditional hyphenation characters inside a word, if present, take priority over automatic resources when determining hyphenation points within the word.

values.name: none
values.desc: Words are not broken at line breaks, even if characters inside the word suggest line break points.

image-orientation.name: image-orientation
image-orientation.desc: Specifies an orthogonal rotation to be applied to an image before it is laid out.

values.name: none
values.desc: Default initial value. Will not apply any additional image rotation; the image is oriented as encoded or as other CSS property values dictate.

values.name: flip  Obsolete since Gecko 63
values.desc: The image is flipped horizontally (i.e., reflected) after the rotation given by the <angle> value is applied. If no <angle> is given, 0deg is used.

image-rendering.name: image-rendering
image-rendering.desc: Gives a hint to the browser about what aspects of an image are most important to preserve when the image is scaled

values.name: auto
values.desc: The image should be scaled with an algorithm that maximizes the appearance of the image.

values.name: optimizeSpeed
values.desc: Deprecated.

values.name: smooth
values.desc: The image should be scaled with an algorithm that maximizes the appearance of the image. In particular, scaling algorithms that "smooth" colors are acceptable, such as bilinear interpolation. This is intended for images such as photos.

values.name: high-quality
values.desc: Identical to smooth, but with a preference for higher-quality scaling. If system resources are constrained, images with high-quality should be prioritized over those with any other value, when considering which images to degrade the quality of and to what degree.

ime-mode.name: ime-mode
ime-mode.desc: Controls the state of the input method editor for text fields.

values.name: auto
values.desc: No change is made to the current input method editor state. This is the default.

values.name: normal
values.desc: The IME state should be normal; this value can be used in a user style sheet to override the page setting.

inline-size.name: inline-size
inline-size.desc: Logical 'height'. Mapping depends on the element’s 'writing-mode'.

values.name: auto
values.desc: Depends on the values of other properties.

isolation.name: isolation
isolation.desc: Defines whether an element must create a new stacking content

values.name: auto
values.desc: Elements are not isolated unless an operation is applied that causes the creation of a stacking context.

values.name: isolate
values.desc: In CSS will turn the element into a stacking context.

justify-content.name: justify-content
justify-content.desc: Specifies the alignment between the items inside a flexible container when the items do not use all available space

values.name: center
values.desc: Flex items are packed toward the center of the line.

values.name: flex-end
values.desc: Flex items are packed toward the end of the line.

values.name: flex-start
values.desc: Flex items are packed toward the start of the line.

values.name: space-around
values.desc: Flex items are evenly distributed in the line, with half-size spaces on either end.

values.name: space-between
values.desc: Flex items are evenly distributed in the line.

values.name: start
values.desc: The items are packed flush to each other toward the start edge of the alignment container in the main axis.

values.name: end
values.desc: The items are packed flush to each other toward the end edge of the alignment container in the main axis.

values.name: left
values.desc: The items are packed flush to each other toward the left edge of the alignment container. If the property’s axis is not parallel with the inline axis, this value behaves like start.

values.name: right
values.desc: The items are packed flush to each other toward the right edge of the alignment container in the appropriate axis. If the property’s axis is not parallel with the inline axis, this value behaves like start.

values.name: normal
values.desc: The items are packed in their default position as if no justify-content value was set. This value behaves as stretch in grid and flex containers.

values.name: baseline
values.desc: Specifies participation in first- or last-baseline alignment: aligns the alignment baseline of the box’s first or last baseline set with the corresponding baseline in the shared first or last baseline set of all the boxes in its baseline-sharing group. The fallback alignment for first baseline is start, the one for last baseline is end.

values.name: space-evenly
values.desc: The items are evenly distributed within the alignment container along the main axis. The spacing between each pair of adjacent items, the main-start edge and the first item, and the main-end edge and the last item, are all exactly the same.

values.name: stretch
values.desc: If the combined size of the items along the main axis is less than the size of the alignment container, any auto-sized items have their size increased equally (not proportionally), while still respecting the constraints imposed by max-height/max-width (or equivalent functionality), so that the combined size exactly fills the alignment container along the main axis.  Note: stretch is not supported by flexible boxes (flexbox).

values.name: safe
values.desc: Used alongside an alignment keyword. If the chosen keyword means that the item overflows the alignment container causing data loss, the item is instead aligned as if the alignment mode were start.

values.name: unsafe
values.desc: Used alongside an alignment keyword. Regardless of the relative sizes of the item and alignment container, and regardless of whether overflow which causes data loss might happen, the given alignment value is honored.

kerning.name: kerning
kerning.desc: Indicates whether the user agent should adjust inter-glyph spacing based on kerning tables that are included in the relevant font or instead disable auto-kerning and set inter-character spacing to a specific length.

values.name: auto
values.desc: Indicates that the user agent should adjust inter-glyph spacing based on kerning tables that are included in the font that will be used.

left.name: left
left.desc: Specifies the left position of a positioned element

values.name: auto
values.desc: For non-replaced elements, the effect of this value depends on which of related properties have the value 'auto' as well

values.name: inherit
values.desc: Specifies that the value is the same as the computed value from its parent element (which might not be its containing block). This computed value is then handled as if it were a <length>, <percentage>, or the auto keyword.

letter-spacing.name: letter-spacing
letter-spacing.desc: Increases or decreases the space between characters in a text

values.name: normal
values.desc: The spacing is the normal spacing for the current font. It is typically zero-length.

lighting-color.name: lighting-color
lighting-color.desc: Defines the color of the light source for filter primitives 'feDiffuseLighting' and 'feSpecularLighting'.

values.name: normal
values.desc: Tells user agents to set the computed value to a 'reasonable' value based on the font size of the element.

values.name: -moz-block-height
values.desc: Sets the line height to the content height of the current block.

mix-blend-mode.name: mix-blend-mode
mix-blend-mode.desc: Specifies how an element's content should blend with its direct parent background

values.name: normal
values.desc: Default attribute which specifies no blending

motion.name: motion
motion.restriction: url, length, percentage, angle, shape, geometry-box, enum

values.name: none
values.desc: No motion path gets created.

values.name: auto
values.desc: Indicates that the object is rotated by the angle of the direction of the motion path.

values.name: reverse
values.desc: Indicates that the object is rotated by the angle of the direction of the motion path plus 180 degrees.

motion-offset.name: motion-offset
motion-offset.desc: A distance that describes the position along the specified motion path.

motion-path.name: motion-path
motion-path.desc: Specifies the motion path the element gets positioned at.

values.name: none
values.desc: No motion path gets created.

motion-rotation.name: motion-rotation
motion-rotation.desc: Defines the direction of the element while positioning along the motion path.

values.name: auto

values.name: reverse

-moz-animation.name: -moz-animation
-moz-animation.desc: Shorthand property combines six of the animation properties into a single property.

values.name: both
values.desc: Both forwards and backwards fill modes are applied.

values.name: infinite
values.desc: Causes the animation to repeat forever.

values.name: none
values.desc: No animation is performed

values.name: normal
values.desc: Normal playback.

values.name: reverse
values.desc: All iterations of the animation are played in the reverse direction from the way they were specified.

-moz-animation-delay.name: -moz-animation-delay
-moz-animation-delay.desc: Defines when the animation will start.

-moz-animation-direction.name: -moz-animation-direction
-moz-animation-direction.desc: Defines whether or not the animation should play in reverse on alternate cycles.

values.name: normal
values.desc: Normal playback.

values.name: reverse
values.desc: All iterations of the animation are played in the reverse direction from the way they were specified.

-moz-animation-duration.name: -moz-animation-duration
-moz-animation-duration.desc: Defines the length of time that an animation takes to complete one cycle.

-moz-animation-iteration-count.name: -moz-animation-iteration-count
-moz-animation-iteration-count.desc: Defines the number of times an animation cycle is played. The default value is one, meaning the animation will play from beginning to end once.

values.name: infinite
values.desc: Causes the animation to repeat forever.

-moz-animation-name.name: -moz-animation-name
-moz-animation-name.desc: Defines a list of animations that apply. Each name is used to select the keyframe at-rule that provides the property values for the animation.

values.name: none
values.desc: No animation is performed

-moz-animation-play-state.name: -moz-animation-play-state
-moz-animation-play-state.desc: Defines whether the animation is running or paused.

-moz-animation-timing-function.name: -moz-animation-timing-function
-moz-animation-timing-function.desc: Describes how the animation will progress over one cycle of its duration. See the 'transition-timing-function'.

-moz-appearance.name: -moz-appearance
-moz-appearance.desc: Used in Gecko (Firefox) to display an element using a platform-native styling based on the operating system's theme.

-moz-backface-visibility.name: -moz-backface-visibility
-moz-backface-visibility.desc: Determines whether or not the 'back' side of a transformed element is visible when facing the viewer. With an identity transform, the front side of an element faces the viewer.

-moz-background-inline-policy.name: -moz-background-inline-policy
-moz-background-inline-policy.desc: In Gecko-based applications like Firefox, the -moz-background-inline-policy CSS property specifies how the background image of an inline element is determined when the content of the inline element wraps onto multiple lines. The choice of position has significant effects on repetition.

-moz-background-origin.name: -moz-background-origin
-moz-background-origin.desc: For elements rendered as a single box, specifies the background positioning area. For elements rendered as multiple boxes (e.g., inline boxes on several lines, boxes on several pages) specifies which boxes 'box-decoration-break' operates on to determine the background positioning area(s).

-moz-border-bottom-colors.name: -moz-border-bottom-colors
-moz-border-bottom-colors.desc: Sets a list of colors for the bottom border.

-moz-border-image.name: -moz-border-image
-moz-border-image.desc: Shorthand property for setting 'border-image-source', 'border-image-slice', 'border-image-width', 'border-image-outset' and 'border-image-repeat'. Omitted values are set to their initial values.

values.name: auto
values.desc: If 'auto' is specified then the border image width is the intrinsic width or height (whichever is applicable) of the corresponding image slice. If the image does not have the required intrinsic dimension then the corresponding border-width is used instead.

values.name: fill
values.desc: Causes the middle part of the border-image to be preserved.

values.name: round
values.desc: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the image is rescaled so that it does.

values.name: space
values.desc: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the extra space is distributed around the tiles.

values.name: stretch
values.desc: The image is stretched to fill the area.

-moz-border-left-colors.name: -moz-border-left-colors
-moz-border-left-colors.desc: Sets a list of colors for the bottom border.

-moz-border-right-colors.name: -moz-border-right-colors
-moz-border-right-colors.desc: Sets a list of colors for the bottom border.

-moz-border-top-colors.name: -moz-border-top-colors
-moz-border-top-colors.desc: Ske Firefox, -moz-border-bottom-colors sets a list of colors for the bottom border.

-moz-box-align.name: -moz-box-align
-moz-box-align.desc: Specifies how a XUL box aligns its contents across (perpendicular to) the direction of its layout. The effect of this is only visible if there is extra space in the box.

values.name: baseline
values.desc: If this box orientation is inline-axis or horizontal, all children are placed with their baselines aligned, and extra space placed before or after as necessary. For block flows, the baseline of the first non-empty line box located within the element is used. For tables, the baseline of the first cell is used.

values.name: center
values.desc: Any extra space is divided evenly, with half placed above the child and the other half placed after the child.

values.name: end
values.desc: For normal direction boxes, the bottom edge of each child is placed along the bottom of the box. Extra space is placed above the element. For reverse direction boxes, the top edge of each child is placed along the top of the box. Extra space is placed below the element.

values.name: start
values.desc: For normal direction boxes, the top edge of each child is placed along the top of the box. Extra space is placed below the element. For reverse direction boxes, the bottom edge of each child is placed along the bottom of the box. Extra space is placed above the element.

values.name: stretch
values.desc: The height of each child is adjusted to that of the containing block.

-moz-box-direction.name: -moz-box-direction
-moz-box-direction.desc: Specifies whether a box lays out its contents normally (from the top or left edge), or in reverse (from the bottom or right edge).

values.name: normal
values.desc: A box with a computed value of horizontal for box-orient displays its children from left to right. A box with a computed value of vertical displays its children from top to bottom.

values.name: reverse
values.desc: A box with a computed value of horizontal for box-orient displays its children from right to left. A box with a computed value of vertical displays its children from bottom to top.

-moz-box-flex.name: -moz-box-flex
-moz-box-flex.desc: Specifies how a box grows to fill the box that contains it, in the direction of the containing box's layout.

-moz-box-flexgroup.name: -moz-box-flexgroup
-moz-box-flexgroup.desc: Flexible elements can be assigned to flex groups using the 'box-flex-group' property.

-moz-box-ordinal-group.name: -moz-box-ordinal-group
-moz-box-ordinal-group.desc: Indicates the ordinal group the element belongs to. Elements with a lower ordinal group are displayed before those with a higher ordinal group.

-moz-box-orient.name: -moz-box-orient
-moz-box-orient.desc: In Mozilla applications, -moz-box-orient specifies whether a box lays out its contents horizontally or vertically.

values.name: horizontal
values.desc: The box displays its children from left to right in a horizontal line.

values.name: vertical
values.desc: The box displays its children from stacked from top to bottom vertically.

-moz-box-pack.name: -moz-box-pack
-moz-box-pack.desc: Specifies how a box packs its contents in the direction of its layout. The effect of this is only visible if there is extra space in the box.

values.name: center
values.desc: The extra space is divided evenly, with half placed before the first child and the other half placed after the last child.

values.name: end
values.desc: For normal direction boxes, the right edge of the last child is placed at the right side, with all extra space placed before the first child. For reverse direction boxes, the left edge of the first child is placed at the left side, with all extra space placed after the last child.

values.name: justify
values.desc: The space is divided evenly in-between each child, with none of the extra space placed before the first child or after the last child. If there is only one child, treat the pack value as if it were start.

values.name: start
values.desc: For normal direction boxes, the left edge of the first child is placed at the left side, with all extra space placed after the last child. For reverse direction boxes, the right edge of the last child is placed at the right side, with all extra space placed before the first child.

-moz-column-count.name: -moz-column-count
-moz-column-count.desc: Describes the optimal number of columns into which the content of the element will be flowed.

values.name: auto
values.desc: Determines the number of columns by the 'column-width' property and the element width.

-moz-column-gap.name: -moz-column-gap
-moz-column-gap.desc: Sets the gap between columns. If there is a column rule between columns, it will appear in the middle of the gap.

values.name: normal
values.desc: User agent specific and typically equivalent to 1em.

-moz-column-rule.name: -moz-column-rule
-moz-column-rule.desc: Shorthand for setting 'column-rule-width', 'column-rule-style', and 'column-rule-color' at the same place in the style sheet. Omitted values are set to their initial values.

-moz-column-rule-color.name: -moz-column-rule-color
-moz-column-rule-color.desc: Sets the color of the column rule

-moz-column-rule-style.name: -moz-column-rule-style
-moz-column-rule-style.desc: Sets the style of the rule between columns of an element.

-moz-column-rule-width.name: -moz-column-rule-width
-moz-column-rule-width.desc: Sets the width of the rule between columns. Negative values are not allowed.

-moz-columns.name: -moz-columns
-moz-columns.desc: A shorthand property which sets both 'column-width' and 'column-count'.

values.name: auto
values.desc: The width depends on the values of other properties.

-moz-column-width.name: -moz-column-width
-moz-column-width.desc: This property describes the width of columns in multicol elements.

values.name: auto
values.desc: The width depends on the values of other properties.

-moz-font-feature-settings.name: -moz-font-feature-settings
-moz-font-feature-settings.desc: Provides low-level control over OpenType font features. It is intended as a way of providing access to font features that are not widely used but are needed for a particular use case.

values.name: normal
values.desc: No change in glyph substitution or positioning occurs.

-moz-hyphens.name: -moz-hyphens
-moz-hyphens.desc: Controls whether hyphenation is allowed to create more break opportunities within a line of text.

values.name: auto
values.desc: Conditional hyphenation characters inside a word, if present, take priority over automatic resources when determining hyphenation points within the word.

values.name: none
values.desc: Words are not broken at line breaks, even if characters inside the word suggest line break points.

-moz-perspective.name: -moz-perspective
-moz-perspective.desc: Applies the same transform as the perspective(<number>) transform function, except that it applies only to the positioned or transformed children of the element, not to the transform on the element itself.

values.name: none
values.desc: No perspective transform is applied.

-moz-perspective-origin.name: -moz-perspective-origin
-moz-perspective-origin.desc: Establishes the origin for the perspective property. It effectively sets the X and Y position at which the viewer appears to be looking at the children of the element.

-moz-text-align-last.name: -moz-text-align-last
-moz-text-align-last.desc: Describes how the last line of a block or a line right before a forced line break is aligned when 'text-align' is set to 'justify'.

values.name: center
values.desc: The inline contents are centered within the line box.

values.name: justify
values.desc: The text is justified according to the method specified by the 'text-justify' property.

values.name: left
values.desc: The inline contents are aligned to the left edge of the line box. In vertical text, 'left' aligns to the edge of the line box that would be the start edge for left-to-right text.

values.name: right
values.desc: The inline contents are aligned to the right edge of the line box. In vertical text, 'right' aligns to the edge of the line box that would be the end edge for left-to-right text.

-moz-text-decoration-color.name: -moz-text-decoration-color
-moz-text-decoration-color.desc: Specifies the color of text decoration (underlines overlines, and line-throughs) set on the element with text-decoration-line.

-moz-text-decoration-line.name: -moz-text-decoration-line
-moz-text-decoration-line.desc: Specifies what line decorations, if any, are added to the element.

values.name: none
values.desc: Neither produces nor inhibits text decoration.

-moz-text-decoration-style.name: -moz-text-decoration-style
-moz-text-decoration-style.desc: Specifies the line style for underline, line-through and overline text decoration.

values.name: none
values.desc: Produces no line.

-moz-text-size-adjust.name: -moz-text-size-adjust
