-moz-text-size-adjust.desc: Specifies a size adjustment for displaying text content in mobile browsers.

values.name: auto
values.desc: Renderers must use the default size adjustment when displaying on a small device.

values.name: none
values.desc: Renderers must not do size adjustment when displaying on a small device.

-moz-transform.name: -moz-transform
-moz-transform.desc: A two-dimensional transformation is applied to an element through the 'transform' property. This property contains a list of transform functions similar to those allowed by SVG.

-moz-transform-origin.name: -moz-transform-origin
-moz-transform-origin.desc: Establishes the origin of transformation for an element.

-moz-transition.name: -moz-transition
-moz-transition.desc: Shorthand property combines four of the transition properties into a single property.

values.name: all
values.desc: Every property that is able to undergo a transition will do so.

values.name: none
values.desc: No property will transition.

-moz-transition-delay.name: -moz-transition-delay
-moz-transition-delay.desc: Defines when the transition will start. It allows a transition to begin execution some period of time from when it is applied.

-moz-transition-duration.name: -moz-transition-duration
-moz-transition-duration.desc: Specifies how long the transition from the old value to the new value should take.

-moz-transition-property.name: -moz-transition-property
-moz-transition-property.desc: Specifies the name of the CSS property to which the transition is applied.

values.name: all
values.desc: Every property that is able to undergo a transition will do so.

values.name: none
values.desc: No property will transition.

-moz-transition-timing-function.name: -moz-transition-timing-function
-moz-transition-timing-function.desc: Describes how the intermediate values used during a transition will be calculated.

-moz-user-focus.name: -moz-user-focus
-moz-user-focus.desc: Used to indicate whether the element can have focus.

-ms-accelerator.name: -ms-accelerator
-ms-accelerator.desc: IE only. Has the ability to turn off its system underlines for accelerator keys until the ALT key is pressed

-ms-behavior.name: -ms-behavior
-ms-behavior.desc: IE only. Used to extend behaviors of the browser

-ms-block-progression.name: -ms-block-progression
-ms-block-progression.desc: Sets the block-progression value and the flow orientation

-ms-content-zoom-chaining.name: -ms-content-zoom-chaining
-ms-content-zoom-chaining.desc: Specifies the zoom behavior that occurs when a user hits the zoom limit during a manipulation.

values.name: chained
values.desc: The nearest zoomable parent element begins zooming when the user hits a zoom limit during a manipulation. No bounce effect is shown.

values.name: none
values.desc: A bounce effect is shown when the user hits a zoom limit during a manipulation.

values.name: none
values.desc: The element is not zoomable.

-ms-content-zoom-limit.name: -ms-content-zoom-limit
-ms-content-zoom-limit.desc: Shorthand property for the -ms-content-zoom-limit-min and -ms-content-zoom-limit-max properties.

values.name: -ms-content-zoom-limit-min
values.desc: Value of the -ms-content-zoom-limit-min property.

values.name: -ms-content-zoom-limit-max
values.desc: Value of the -ms-content-zoom-limit-max property.

-ms-content-zoom-snap.name: -ms-content-zoom-snap
-ms-content-zoom-snap.desc: Shorthand property for the -ms-content-zoom-snap-type and -ms-content-zoom-snap-points properties.

values.name: mandatory
values.desc: Indicates that the motion of the content after the contact is picked up is always adjusted so that it lands on a snap-point.

values.name: none
values.desc: Indicates that zooming is unaffected by any defined snap-points.

values.name: proximity
values.desc: Indicates that the motion of the content after the contact is picked up may be adjusted if the content would normally stop "close enough" to a snap-point.

values.name: snapInterval(100%, 100%)
values.desc: Specifies where the snap-points will be placed.

values.name: snapList()
values.desc: Specifies the position of individual snap-points as a comma-separated list of zoom factors.

values.name: -ms-content-zoom-snap-type
values.desc: Value of the -ms-content-zoom-snap-type property.

values.name: -ms-content-zoom-snap-points
values.desc: Value of the -ms-content-zoom-snap-points property.

-ms-content-zoom-snap-points.name: -ms-content-zoom-snap-points
-ms-content-zoom-snap-points.desc: Defines where zoom snap-points are located.

values.name: snapInterval(100%, 100%)
values.desc: Specifies where the snap-points will be placed.

values.name: snapList()
values.desc: Specifies the position of individual snap-points as a comma-separated list of zoom factors.

values.name: snapInterval( <percentage>, <percentage> )
values.desc: Specifies where the snap-points will be placed. The first percentage specifies where the first snap-point will be placed.The second percentage specifies the distance between subsequent snap-points, both zoomed in and zoomed out from the initial snap-point.

values.name: snapList( <percentage># )
values.desc: Specifies the position of individual snap-points as a comma-separated list of percentages, each of which represents a zoom factor. If any value specified is less than that specified by the -ms-content-zoom-limit-min property, the value of -ms-content-zoom-limit-min is used.If any value specified is greater than that specified by the -ms-content-zoom-limit-max property, the value of -ms-content-zoom-limit-max is used.

-ms-content-zoom-snap-type.name: -ms-content-zoom-snap-type
-ms-content-zoom-snap-type.desc: Specifies how zooming is affected by defined snap-points.

values.name: mandatory
values.desc: Indicates that the motion of the content after the contact is picked up is always adjusted so that it lands on a snap-point.

values.name: none
values.desc: Indicates that zooming is unaffected by any defined snap-points.

values.name: proximity
values.desc: Indicates that the motion of the content after the contact is picked up may be adjusted if the content would normally stop "close enough" to a snap-point.

-ms-filter.name: -ms-filter
-ms-filter.desc: IE only. Used to produce visual effects.

-ms-flex.name: -ms-flex
-ms-flex.desc: specifies the parameters of a flexible length: the positive and negative flexibility, and the preferred size.

values.name: auto
values.desc: Retrieves the value of the main size property as the used 'flex-basis'.

values.name: none
values.desc: Expands to '0 0 auto'.

-ms-flex-align.name: -ms-flex-align
-ms-flex-align.desc: Aligns flex items along the cross axis of the current line of the flex container.

values.name: baseline
values.desc: If the flex item’s inline axis is the same as the cross axis, this value is identical to 'flex-start'. Otherwise, it participates in baseline alignment.

values.name: center
values.desc: The flex item’s margin box is centered in the cross axis within the line.

values.name: end
values.desc: The cross-end margin edge of the flex item is placed flush with the cross-end edge of the line.

values.name: start
values.desc: The cross-start margin edge of the flexbox item is placed flush with the cross-start edge of the line.

values.name: stretch
values.desc: If the cross size property of the flexbox item is anything other than 'auto', this value is identical to 'start'.

-ms-flex-direction.name: -ms-flex-direction
-ms-flex-direction.desc: Specifies how flex items are placed in the flex container, by setting the direction of the flex container’s main axis.

values.name: column
values.desc: The flex container’s main axis has the same orientation as the block axis of the current writing mode.

values.name: row
values.desc: The flex container’s main axis has the same orientation as the inline axis of the current writing mode.

-ms-flex-flow.name: -ms-flex-flow
-ms-flex-flow.desc: Specifies how flexbox items are placed in the flexbox.

values.name: column
values.desc: The flex container’s main axis has the same orientation as the block axis of the current writing mode.

values.name: nowrap
values.desc: The flex container is single-line.

values.name: row
values.desc: The flex container’s main axis has the same orientation as the inline axis of the current writing mode.

values.name: wrap
values.desc: The flexbox is multi-line.

-ms-flex-item-align.name: -ms-flex-item-align
-ms-flex-item-align.desc: Allows the default alignment along the cross axis to be overridden for individual flex items.

values.name: auto
values.desc: Computes to the value of 'align-items' on the element’s parent, or 'stretch' if the element has no parent. On absolutely positioned elements, it computes to itself.

values.name: baseline
values.desc: If the flex item’s inline axis is the same as the cross axis, this value is identical to 'flex-start'. Otherwise, it participates in baseline alignment.

values.name: center
values.desc: The flex item’s margin box is centered in the cross axis within the line.

values.name: end
values.desc: The cross-end margin edge of the flex item is placed flush with the cross-end edge of the line.

values.name: start
values.desc: The cross-start margin edge of the flex item is placed flush with the cross-start edge of the line.

values.name: stretch
values.desc: If the cross size property of the flex item computes to auto, and neither of the cross-axis margins are auto, the flex item is stretched.

-ms-flex-line-pack.name: -ms-flex-line-pack
-ms-flex-line-pack.desc: Aligns a flex container’s lines within the flex container when there is extra space in the cross-axis, similar to how 'justify-content' aligns individual items within the main-axis.

values.name: center
values.desc: Lines are packed toward the center of the flex container.

values.name: distribute
values.desc: Lines are evenly distributed in the flex container, with half-size spaces on either end.

values.name: end
values.desc: Lines are packed toward the end of the flex container.

values.name: justify
values.desc: Lines are evenly distributed in the flex container.

values.name: start
values.desc: Lines are packed toward the start of the flex container.

values.name: stretch
values.desc: Lines stretch to take up the remaining space.

-ms-flex-order.name: -ms-flex-order
-ms-flex-order.desc: Controls the order in which children of a flex container appear within the flex container, by assigning them to ordinal groups.

-ms-flex-pack.name: -ms-flex-pack
-ms-flex-pack.desc: Aligns flex items along the main axis of the current line of the flex container.

values.name: center
values.desc: Flex items are packed toward the center of the line.

values.name: distribute
values.desc: Flex items are evenly distributed in the line, with half-size spaces on either end.

values.name: end
values.desc: Flex items are packed toward the end of the line.

values.name: justify
values.desc: Flex items are evenly distributed in the line.

values.name: start
values.desc: Flex items are packed toward the start of the line.

-ms-flex-wrap.name: -ms-flex-wrap
-ms-flex-wrap.desc: Controls whether the flex container is single-line or multi-line, and the direction of the cross-axis, which determines the direction new lines are stacked in.

values.name: nowrap
values.desc: The flex container is single-line.

values.name: wrap
values.desc: The flexbox is multi-line.

-ms-flow-from.name: -ms-flow-from
-ms-flow-from.desc: Makes a block container a region and associates it with a named flow.

values.name: none
values.desc: The block container is not a CSS Region.

-ms-flow-into.name: -ms-flow-into
-ms-flow-into.desc: Places an element or its contents into a named flow.

values.name: none
values.desc: The element is not moved to a named flow and normal CSS processing takes place.

-ms-grid-column.name: -ms-grid-column
-ms-grid-column.desc: Used to place grid items and explicitly defined grid cells in the Grid.

-ms-grid-column-align.name: -ms-grid-column-align
-ms-grid-column-align.desc: Aligns the columns in a grid.

values.name: center
values.desc: Places the center of the Grid Item's margin box at the center of the Grid Item's column.

values.name: end
values.desc: Aligns the end edge of the Grid Item's margin box to the end edge of the Grid Item's column.

values.name: start
values.desc: Aligns the starting edge of the Grid Item's margin box to the starting edge of the Grid Item's column.

values.name: stretch
values.desc: Ensures that the Grid Item's margin box is equal to the size of the Grid Item's column.

-ms-grid-columns.name: -ms-grid-columns
-ms-grid-columns.desc: Lays out the columns of the grid.

-ms-grid-column-span.name: -ms-grid-column-span
-ms-grid-column-span.desc: Specifies the number of columns to span.

-ms-grid-layer.name: -ms-grid-layer
-ms-grid-layer.desc: Grid-layer is similar in concept to z-index, but avoids overloading the meaning of the z-index property, which is applicable only to positioned elements.

-ms-grid-row.name: -ms-grid-row
-ms-grid-row.desc: grid-row is used to place grid items and explicitly defined grid cells in the Grid.

-ms-grid-row-align.name: -ms-grid-row-align
-ms-grid-row-align.desc: Aligns the rows in a grid.

values.name: center
values.desc: Places the center of the Grid Item's margin box at the center of the Grid Item's row.

values.name: end
values.desc: Aligns the end edge of the Grid Item's margin box to the end edge of the Grid Item's row.

values.name: start
values.desc: Aligns the starting edge of the Grid Item's margin box to the starting edge of the Grid Item's row.

values.name: stretch
values.desc: Ensures that the Grid Item's margin box is equal to the size of the Grid Item's row.

-ms-grid-rows.name: -ms-grid-rows
-ms-grid-rows.desc: Lays out the columns of the grid.

-ms-grid-row-span.name: -ms-grid-row-span
-ms-grid-row-span.desc: Specifies the number of rows to span.

-ms-high-contrast-adjust.name: -ms-high-contrast-adjust
-ms-high-contrast-adjust.desc: Specifies if properties should be adjusted in high contrast mode.

values.name: auto
values.desc: Properties will be adjusted as applicable.

values.name: none
values.desc: No adjustments will be applied.

-ms-hyphenate-limit-chars.name: -ms-hyphenate-limit-chars
-ms-hyphenate-limit-chars.desc: Specifies the minimum number of characters in a hyphenated word.

values.name: auto
values.desc: The user agent chooses a value that adapts to the current layout.

-ms-hyphenate-limit-lines.name: -ms-hyphenate-limit-lines
-ms-hyphenate-limit-lines.desc: Indicates the maximum number of successive hyphenated lines in an element.

-ms-hyphenate-limit-zone.name: -ms-hyphenate-limit-zone
-ms-hyphenate-limit-zone.desc: Specifies the maximum amount of unfilled space (before justification) that may be left in the line box before hyphenation is triggered to pull part of a word from the next line back up into the current line.

-ms-hyphens.name: -ms-hyphens
-ms-hyphens.desc: Controls whether hyphenation is allowed to create more break opportunities within a line of text.

values.name: auto
values.desc: Conditional hyphenation characters inside a word, if present, take priority over automatic resources when determining hyphenation points within the word.

values.name: none
values.desc: Words are not broken at line breaks, even if characters inside the word suggest line break points.

-ms-ime-mode.name: -ms-ime-mode
-ms-ime-mode.desc: Controls the state of the input method editor for text fields.

values.name: auto
values.desc: No change is made to the current input method editor state. This is the default.

values.name: normal
values.desc: The IME state should be normal; this value can be used in a user style sheet to override the page setting.

-ms-interpolation-mode.name: -ms-interpolation-mode
-ms-interpolation-mode.desc: Gets or sets the interpolation (resampling) method used to stretch images.

-ms-layout-grid.name: -ms-layout-grid
-ms-layout-grid.desc: Sets or retrieves the composite document grid properties that specify the layout of text characters.

values.name: char
values.desc: Any of the range of character values available to the -ms-layout-grid-char property.

values.name: line
values.desc: Any of the range of line values available to the -ms-layout-grid-line property.

-ms-layout-grid-char.name: -ms-layout-grid-char
-ms-layout-grid-char.desc: Sets or retrieves the size of the character grid used for rendering the text content of an element.

values.name: auto
values.desc: Largest character in the font of the element is used to set the character grid.

values.name: none
values.desc: Default. No character grid is set.

-ms-layout-grid-line.name: -ms-layout-grid-line
-ms-layout-grid-line.desc: Sets or retrieves the gridline value used for rendering the text content of an element.

values.name: auto
values.desc: Largest character in the font of the element is used to set the character grid.

values.name: none
values.desc: Default. No grid line is set.

-ms-layout-grid-mode.name: -ms-layout-grid-mode
-ms-layout-grid-mode.desc: Gets or sets whether the text layout grid uses two dimensions.

values.name: both
values.desc: Default. Both the char and line grid modes are enabled. This setting is necessary to fully enable the layout grid on an element.

values.name: char
values.desc: Only a character grid is used. This is recommended for use with block-level elements, such as a blockquote, where the line grid is intended to be disabled.

values.name: line
values.desc: Only a line grid is used. This is recommended for use with inline elements, such as a span, to disable the horizontal grid on runs of text that act as a single entity in the grid layout.

values.name: none
values.desc: No grid is used.

-ms-layout-grid-type.name: -ms-layout-grid-type
-ms-layout-grid-type.desc: Sets or retrieves the type of grid used for rendering the text content of an element.

values.name: fixed
values.desc: Grid used for monospaced layout. All noncursive characters are treated as equal; every character is centered within a single grid space by default.

values.name: strict
values.desc: Grid used for Chinese, as well as Japanese (Genko) and Korean characters. Only the ideographs, kanas, and wide characters are snapped to the grid.

-ms-line-break.name: -ms-line-break
-ms-line-break.desc: Specifies what set of line breaking restrictions are in effect within the element.

values.name: auto
values.desc: The UA determines the set of line-breaking restrictions to use for CJK scripts, and it may vary the restrictions based on the length of the line; e.g., use a less restrictive set of line-break rules for short lines.

values.name: keep-all
values.desc: Sequences of CJK characters can no longer break on implied break points. This option should only be used where the presence of word separator characters still creates line-breaking opportunities, as in Korean.

values.name: newspaper
values.desc: Breaks CJK scripts using the least restrictive set of line-breaking rules. Typically used for short lines, such as in newspapers.

values.name: normal
values.desc: Breaks CJK scripts using a normal set of line-breaking rules.

values.name: strict
values.desc: Breaks CJK scripts using a more restrictive set of line-breaking rules than 'normal'.

-ms-overflow-style.name: -ms-overflow-style
-ms-overflow-style.desc: Specify whether content is clipped when it overflows the element's content area.

values.name: auto
values.desc: No preference, UA should use the first scrolling method in the list that it supports.

values.name: none
values.desc: Indicates the element does not display scrollbars or panning indicators, even when its content overflows.

-ms-perspective.name: -ms-perspective
-ms-perspective.desc: Applies the same transform as the perspective(<number>) transform function, except that it applies only to the positioned or transformed children of the element, not to the transform on the element itself.

values.name: none
values.desc: No perspective transform is applied.

-ms-perspective-origin.name: -ms-perspective-origin
-ms-perspective-origin.desc: Establishes the origin for the perspective property. It effectively sets the X and Y position at which the viewer appears to be looking at the children of the element.

-ms-perspective-origin-x.name: -ms-perspective-origin-x
-ms-perspective-origin-x.desc: Establishes the origin for the perspective property. It effectively sets the X  position at which the viewer appears to be looking at the children of the element.

-ms-perspective-origin-y.name: -ms-perspective-origin-y
-ms-perspective-origin-y.desc: Establishes the origin for the perspective property. It effectively sets the Y position at which the viewer appears to be looking at the children of the element.

-ms-progress-appearance.name: -ms-progress-appearance
-ms-progress-appearance.desc: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether a progress control displays as a bar or a ring.

-ms-scrollbar-3dlight-color.name: -ms-scrollbar-3dlight-color
-ms-scrollbar-3dlight-color.desc: Determines the color of the top and left edges of the scroll box and scroll arrows of a scroll bar.

-ms-scrollbar-arrow-color.name: -ms-scrollbar-arrow-color
-ms-scrollbar-arrow-color.desc: Determines the color of the arrow elements of a scroll arrow.

-ms-scrollbar-base-color.name: -ms-scrollbar-base-color
-ms-scrollbar-base-color.desc: Determines the color of the main elements of a scroll bar, which include the scroll box, track, and scroll arrows.

-ms-scrollbar-darkshadow-color.name: -ms-scrollbar-darkshadow-color
-ms-scrollbar-darkshadow-color.desc: Determines the color of the gutter of a scroll bar.

-ms-scrollbar-face-color.name: -ms-scrollbar-face-color
-ms-scrollbar-face-color.desc: Determines the color of the scroll box and scroll arrows of a scroll bar.

-ms-scrollbar-highlight-color.name: -ms-scrollbar-highlight-color
-ms-scrollbar-highlight-color.desc: Determines the color of the top and left edges of the scroll box and scroll arrows of a scroll bar.

-ms-scrollbar-shadow-color.name: -ms-scrollbar-shadow-color
-ms-scrollbar-shadow-color.desc: Determines the color of the bottom and right edges of the scroll box and scroll arrows of a scroll bar.

-ms-scrollbar-track-color.name: -ms-scrollbar-track-color
-ms-scrollbar-track-color.desc: Determines the color of the track element of a scroll bar.

-ms-scroll-chaining.name: -ms-scroll-chaining
-ms-scroll-chaining.desc: Gets or sets a value that indicates the scrolling behavior that occurs when a user hits the content boundary during a manipulation.

-ms-scroll-limit.name: -ms-scroll-limit
-ms-scroll-limit.desc: Gets or sets a shorthand value that sets values for the -ms-scroll-limit-x-min, -ms-scroll-limit-y-min, -ms-scroll-limit-x-max, and -ms-scroll-limit-y-max properties.

values.name: -ms-scroll-limit-x-min
values.desc: The value of the -ms-scroll-limit-x-min property.

values.name: -ms-scroll-limit-y-min
values.desc: The value of the -ms-scroll-limit-y-min property.

values.name: -ms-scroll-limit-x-max
values.desc: The value of the -ms-scroll-limit-x-max property.

values.name: -ms-scroll-limit-y-max
values.desc: The value of the -ms-scroll-limit-y-max property.

-ms-scroll-limit-x-max.name: -ms-scroll-limit-x-max
-ms-scroll-limit-x-max.desc: Gets or sets a value that specifies the maximum value for the scrollLeft property.

-ms-scroll-limit-x-min.name: -ms-scroll-limit-x-min
-ms-scroll-limit-x-min.desc: Gets or sets a value that specifies the minimum value for the scrollLeft property.

-ms-scroll-limit-y-max.name: -ms-scroll-limit-y-max
-ms-scroll-limit-y-max.desc: Gets or sets a value that specifies the maximum value for the scrollTop property.

-ms-scroll-limit-y-min.name: -ms-scroll-limit-y-min
-ms-scroll-limit-y-min.desc: Gets or sets a value that specifies the minimum value for the scrollTop property.

-ms-scroll-rails.name: -ms-scroll-rails
-ms-scroll-rails.desc: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether or not small motions perpendicular to the primary axis of motion will result in either changes to both the scrollTop and scrollLeft properties or a change to the primary axis (for instance, either the scrollTop or scrollLeft properties will change, but not both).

-ms-scroll-snap-points-x.name: -ms-scroll-snap-points-x
-ms-scroll-snap-points-x.desc: Gets or sets a value that defines where snap-points will be located along the x-axis.

-ms-scroll-snap-points-y.name: -ms-scroll-snap-points-y
-ms-scroll-snap-points-y.desc: Gets or sets a value that defines where snap-points will be located along the y-axis.

-ms-scroll-snap-type.name: -ms-scroll-snap-type
-ms-scroll-snap-type.desc: Gets or sets a value that defines what type of snap-point should be used for the current element. There are two type of snap-points, with the primary difference being whether or not the user is guaranteed to always stop on a snap-point.

values.name: none
values.desc: The visual viewport of this scroll container must ignore snap points, if any, when scrolled.

values.name: mandatory
values.desc: The visual viewport of this scroll container is guaranteed to rest on a snap point when there are no active scrolling operations.

values.name: proximity
values.desc: The visual viewport of this scroll container may come to rest on a snap point at the termination of a scroll at the discretion of the UA given the parameters of the scroll.

values.name: x
values.desc: The scroll container snaps to snap positions in its horizontal axis only.

values.name: y
values.desc: The scroll container snaps to snap positions in its vertical axis only.

values.name: block
values.desc: The scroll container snaps to snap positions in its block axis only.

values.name: inline
values.desc: The scroll container snaps to snap positions in its inline axis only.

values.name: both
values.desc: The scroll container snaps to snap positions in both of its axes independently (potentially snapping to different elements in each axis).

-ms-scroll-snap-x.name: -ms-scroll-snap-x
-ms-scroll-snap-x.desc: Gets or sets a shorthand value that sets values for the -ms-scroll-snap-type and -ms-scroll-snap-points-x properties.

-ms-scroll-snap-y.name: -ms-scroll-snap-y
-ms-scroll-snap-y.desc: Gets or sets a shorthand value that sets values for the -ms-scroll-snap-type and -ms-scroll-snap-points-y properties.

-ms-scroll-translation.name: -ms-scroll-translation
-ms-scroll-translation.desc: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether vertical-to-horizontal scroll wheel translation occurs on the specified element.

values.name: inherit
values.desc: The initial value. The value is inherited from the element's parent element.

-ms-text-align-last.name: -ms-text-align-last
-ms-text-align-last.desc: Describes how the last line of a block or a line right before a forced line break is aligned when 'text-align' is set to 'justify'.

values.name: center
values.desc: The inline contents are centered within the line box.

values.name: justify
values.desc: The text is justified according to the method specified by the 'text-justify' property.

values.name: left
values.desc: The inline contents are aligned to the left edge of the line box. In vertical text, 'left' aligns to the edge of the line box that would be the start edge for left-to-right text.

values.name: right
values.desc: The inline contents are aligned to the right edge of the line box. In vertical text, 'right' aligns to the edge of the line box that would be the end edge for left-to-right text.

-ms-text-autospace.name: -ms-text-autospace
-ms-text-autospace.desc: Determines whether or not a full-width punctuation mark character should be trimmed if it appears at the beginning of a line, so that its 'ink' lines up with the first glyph in the line above and below.

values.name: none
values.desc: No extra space is created.

-ms-text-combine-horizontal.name: -ms-text-combine-horizontal
-ms-text-combine-horizontal.desc: This property specifies the combination of multiple characters into the space of a single character.

values.name: all
values.desc: Attempt to typeset horizontally all consecutive characters within the box such that they take up the space of a single character within the vertical line box.

values.name: none
values.desc: No special processing.

-ms-text-justify.name: -ms-text-justify
-ms-text-justify.desc: Selects the justification algorithm used when 'text-align' is set to 'justify'. The property applies to block containers, but the UA may (but is not required to) also support it on inline elements.

values.name: auto
values.desc: The UA determines the justification algorithm to follow, based on a balance between performance and adequate presentation quality.

values.name: distribute
values.desc: Justification primarily changes spacing both at word separators and at grapheme cluster boundaries in all scripts except those in the connected and cursive groups. This value is sometimes used in e.g. Japanese, often with the 'text-align-last' property.

-ms-text-kashida-space.name: -ms-text-kashida-space
-ms-text-kashida-space.desc: Sets or retrieves the ratio of kashida expansion to white space expansion when justifying lines of text in the object.

-ms-text-overflow.name: -ms-text-overflow
-ms-text-overflow.desc: Text can overflow for example when it is prevented from wrapping

-ms-text-size-adjust.name: -ms-text-size-adjust
-ms-text-size-adjust.desc: Specifies a size adjustment for displaying text content in mobile browsers.

values.name: auto
values.desc: Renderers must use the default size adjustment when displaying on a small device.

values.name: none
values.desc: Renderers must not do size adjustment when displaying on a small device.

-ms-text-underline-position.name: -ms-text-underline-position
-ms-text-underline-position.desc: Sets the position of an underline specified on the same element: it does not affect underlines specified by ancestor elements.This property is typically used in vertical writing contexts such as in Japanese documents where it often desired to have the underline appear 'over' (to the right of) the affected run of text

values.name: alphabetic
values.desc: The underline is aligned with the alphabetic baseline. In this case the underline is likely to cross some descenders.

values.name: auto
values.desc: The user agent may use any algorithm to determine the underline's position. In horizontal line layout, the underline should be aligned as for alphabetic. In vertical line layout, if the language is set to Japanese or Korean, the underline should be aligned as for over.

-ms-touch-action.name: -ms-touch-action
-ms-touch-action.desc: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether and how a given region can be manipulated by the user.

values.name: auto
values.desc: The element is a passive element, with several exceptions.

values.name: double-tap-zoom
values.desc: The element will zoom on double-tap.

values.name: manipulation
values.desc: The element is a manipulation-causing element.

values.name: none
values.desc: The element is a manipulation-blocking element.

values.name: pan-x
values.desc: The element permits touch-driven panning on the horizontal axis. The touch pan is performed on the nearest ancestor with horizontally scrollable content.

values.name: pan-y
values.desc: The element permits touch-driven panning on the vertical axis. The touch pan is performed on the nearest ancestor with vertically scrollable content.

values.name: pinch-zoom
values.desc: The element permits pinch-zooming. The pinch-zoom is performed on the nearest ancestor with zoomable content.

-ms-touch-select.name: -ms-touch-select
-ms-touch-select.desc: Gets or sets a value that toggles the 'gripper' visual elements that enable touch text selection.

values.name: none
values.desc: Grippers are always off.

-ms-transform.name: -ms-transform
-ms-transform.desc: A two-dimensional transformation is applied to an element through the 'transform' property. This property contains a list of transform functions similar to those allowed by SVG.

-ms-transform-origin.name: -ms-transform-origin
-ms-transform-origin.desc: Establishes the origin of transformation for an element.

-ms-transform-origin-x.name: -ms-transform-origin-x
-ms-transform-origin-x.desc: The x coordinate of the origin for transforms applied to an element with respect to its border box.

-ms-transform-origin-y.name: -ms-transform-origin-y
-ms-transform-origin-y.desc: The y coordinate of the origin for transforms applied to an element with respect to its border box.

-ms-transform-origin-z.name: -ms-transform-origin-z
-ms-transform-origin-z.desc: The z coordinate of the origin for transforms applied to an element with respect to its border box.

-ms-word-break.name: -ms-word-break
-ms-word-break.desc: Specifies line break opportunities for non-CJK scripts.

values.name: keep-all
values.desc: Block characters can no longer create implied break points.

values.name: normal
values.desc: Breaks non-CJK scripts according to their own rules.

-ms-word-wrap.name: -ms-word-wrap
-ms-word-wrap.desc: Specifies whether the UA may break within a word to prevent overflow when an otherwise-unbreakable string is too long to fit.

values.name: break-word
values.desc: An unbreakable 'word' may be broken at an arbitrary point if there are no otherwise-acceptable break points in the line.

values.name: normal
values.desc: Lines may break only at allowed break points.

-ms-wrap-flow.name: -ms-wrap-flow
-ms-wrap-flow.desc: An element becomes an exclusion when its 'wrap-flow' property has a computed value other than 'auto'.

values.name: auto
values.desc: For floats an exclusion is created, for all other elements an exclusion is not created.

values.name: both
values.desc: Inline flow content can flow on all sides of the exclusion.

values.name: end
values.desc: Inline flow content can wrap on the end side of the exclusion area but must leave the area to the start edge of the exclusion area empty.

values.name: start
values.desc: Inline flow content can wrap on the start edge of the exclusion area but must leave the area to end edge of the exclusion area empty.

-ms-wrap-margin.name: -ms-wrap-margin
-ms-wrap-margin.desc: Gets or sets a value that is used to offset the inner wrap shape from other shapes.

-ms-wrap-through.name: -ms-wrap-through
-ms-wrap-through.desc: Specifies if an element inherits its parent wrapping context. In other words if it is subject to the exclusions defined outside the element.

values.name: none
values.desc: The exclusion element does not inherit its parent node's wrapping context. Its descendants are only subject to exclusion shapes defined inside the element.

values.name: wrap
values.desc: The exclusion element inherits its parent node's wrapping context. Its descendant inline content wraps around exclusions defined outside the element.

-ms-zoom.name: -ms-zoom
-ms-zoom.desc: Sets or retrieves the magnification scale of the object.

-ms-zoom-animation.name: -ms-zoom-animation
-ms-zoom-animation.desc: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether an animation is used when zooming.

nav-down.name: nav-down
nav-down.desc: Provides an way to control directional focus navigation.

values.name: auto
values.desc: The user agent automatically determines which element to navigate the focus to in response to directional navigational input.

nav-index.name: nav-index
nav-index.desc: Provides an input-method-neutral way of specifying the sequential navigation order (also known as 'tabbing order').

values.name: auto
values.desc: The element's sequential navigation order is assigned automatically by the user agent.

nav-left.name: nav-left
nav-left.desc: Provides an way to control directional focus navigation.

values.name: auto
values.desc: The user agent automatically determines which element to navigate the focus to in response to directional navigational input.

nav-right.name: nav-right
nav-right.desc: Provides an way to control directional focus navigation.

values.name: auto
values.desc: The user agent automatically determines which element to navigate the focus to in response to directional navigational input.

nav-up.name: nav-up
nav-up.desc: Provides an way to control directional focus navigation.

values.name: auto
values.desc: The user agent automatically determines which element to navigate the focus to in response to directional navigational input.

negative.name: negative
negative.desc: @counter-style descriptor. Defines how to alter the representation when the counter value is negative.

-o-animation.name: -o-animation
-o-animation.desc: Shorthand property combines six of the animation properties into a single property.

values.name: both
values.desc: Both forwards and backwards fill modes are applied.

values.name: infinite
values.desc: Causes the animation to repeat forever.

values.name: none
values.desc: No animation is performed

values.name: normal
values.desc: Normal playback.

values.name: reverse
values.desc: All iterations of the animation are played in the reverse direction from the way they were specified.

-o-animation-delay.name: -o-animation-delay
-o-animation-delay.desc: Defines when the animation will start.

-o-animation-direction.name: -o-animation-direction
-o-animation-direction.desc: Defines whether or not the animation should play in reverse on alternate cycles.

values.name: normal
values.desc: Normal playback.

values.name: reverse
values.desc: All iterations of the animation are played in the reverse direction from the way they were specified.

-o-animation-duration.name: -o-animation-duration
-o-animation-duration.desc: Defines the length of time that an animation takes to complete one cycle.

-o-animation-fill-mode.name: -o-animation-fill-mode
-o-animation-fill-mode.desc: Defines what values are applied by the animation outside the time it is executing.

values.name: both
values.desc: Both forwards and backwards fill modes are applied.

values.name: none
values.desc: There is no change to the property value between the time the animation is applied and the time the animation begins playing or after the animation completes.

-o-animation-iteration-count.name: -o-animation-iteration-count
-o-animation-iteration-count.desc: Defines the number of times an animation cycle is played. The default value is one, meaning the animation will play from beginning to end once.

values.name: infinite
values.desc: Causes the animation to repeat forever.

-o-animation-name.name: -o-animation-name
-o-animation-name.desc: Defines a list of animations that apply. Each name is used to select the keyframe at-rule that provides the property values for the animation.

values.name: none
values.desc: No animation is performed

-o-animation-play-state.name: -o-animation-play-state
-o-animation-play-state.desc: Defines whether the animation is running or paused.

-o-animation-timing-function.name: -o-animation-timing-function
-o-animation-timing-function.desc: Describes how the animation will progress over one cycle of its duration. See the 'transition-timing-function'.

object-fit.name: object-fit
object-fit.desc: Specifies how the contents of a replaced element should be fitted to the box established by its used height and width

values.name: contain
values.desc: The replaced content is sized to maintain its aspect ratio while fitting within the element’s content box: its concrete object size is resolved as a contain constraint against the element's used width and height.

values.name: cover
values.desc: The replaced content is sized to maintain its aspect ratio while filling the element's entire content box: its concrete object size is resolved as a cover constraint against the element’s used width and height.

values.name: fill
values.desc: The replaced content is sized to fill the element’s content box: the object's concrete object size is the element's used width and height.

values.name: none
values.desc: The replaced content is not resized to fit inside the element's content box

object-position.name: object-position
object-position.desc: Specifies the alignment of the replaced element inside its box

-o-border-image.name: -o-border-image
-o-border-image.desc: Shorthand property for setting 'border-image-source', 'border-image-slice', 'border-image-width', 'border-image-outset' and 'border-image-repeat'. Omitted values are set to their initial values.

values.name: auto
values.desc: If 'auto' is specified then the border image width is the intrinsic width or height (whichever is applicable) of the corresponding image slice. If the image does not have the required intrinsic dimension then the corresponding border-width is used instead.

values.name: fill
values.desc: Causes the middle part of the border-image to be preserved.

values.name: round
values.desc: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the image is rescaled so that it does.

values.name: space
values.desc: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the extra space is distributed around the tiles.

values.name: stretch
values.desc: The image is stretched to fill the area.

-o-object-fit.name: -o-object-fit
-o-object-fit.desc: Specifies how the contents of a replaced element should be scaled relative to the box established by its used height and width.

values.name: contain
values.desc: The replaced content is sized to maintain its aspect ratio while fitting within the element’s content box: its concrete object size is resolved as a contain constraint against the element's used width and height.

values.name: cover
values.desc: The replaced content is sized to maintain its aspect ratio while filling the element's entire content box: its concrete object size is resolved as a cover constraint against the element’s used width and height.

values.name: fill
values.desc: The replaced content is sized to fill the element’s content box: the object's concrete object size is the element's used width and height.

values.name: none
values.desc: The replaced content is not resized to fit inside the element's content box

-o-object-position.name: -o-object-position
-o-object-position.desc: Determines the alignment of the replaced element inside its box.

opacity.name: opacity
opacity.desc: Sets the opacity level for an element

order.name: order
order.desc: Sets the order of the flexible item, relative to the rest

orphans.name: orphans
orphans.desc: Sets the minimum number of lines that must be left at the bottom of a page when a page break occurs inside an element

-o-table-baseline.name: -o-table-baseline
-o-table-baseline.desc: Determines which row of a inline-table should be used as baseline of inline-table.

-o-tab-size.name: -o-tab-size
-o-tab-size.desc: This property determines the width of the tab character (U+0009), in space characters (U+0020), when rendered.

-o-text-overflow.name: -o-text-overflow
-o-text-overflow.desc: Text can overflow for example when it is prevented from wrapping

-o-transform.name: -o-transform
-o-transform.desc: A two-dimensional transformation is applied to an element through the 'transform' property. This property contains a list of transform functions similar to those allowed by SVG.

-o-transform-origin.name: -o-transform-origin
-o-transform-origin.desc: Establishes the origin of transformation for an element.

-o-transition.name: -o-transition
-o-transition.desc: Shorthand property combines four of the transition properties into a single property.

values.name: all
values.desc: Every property that is able to undergo a transition will do so.

values.name: none
values.desc: No property will transition.

-o-transition-delay.name: -o-transition-delay
-o-transition-delay.desc: Defines when the transition will start. It allows a transition to begin execution some period of time from when it is applied.

-o-transition-duration.name: -o-transition-duration
-o-transition-duration.desc: Specifies how long the transition from the old value to the new value should take.

-o-transition-property.name: -o-transition-property
-o-transition-property.desc: Specifies the name of the CSS property to which the transition is applied.

values.name: all
values.desc: Every property that is able to undergo a transition will do so.

values.name: none
values.desc: No property will transition.

-o-transition-timing-function.name: -o-transition-timing-function
-o-transition-timing-function.desc: Describes how the intermediate values used during a transition will be calculated.

offset-block-end.name: offset-block-end
offset-block-end.desc: Logical 'bottom'. Mapping depends on the parent element’s 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

values.name: auto
values.desc: For non-replaced elements, the effect of this value depends on which of related properties have the value 'auto' as well.

offset-block-start.name: offset-block-start
offset-block-start.desc: Logical 'top'. Mapping depends on the parent element’s 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

values.name: auto
values.desc: For non-replaced elements, the effect of this value depends on which of related properties have the value 'auto' as well.

offset-inline-end.name: offset-inline-end
offset-inline-end.desc: Logical 'right'. Mapping depends on the parent element’s 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

values.name: auto
values.desc: For non-replaced elements, the effect of this value depends on which of related properties have the value 'auto' as well.

offset-inline-start.name: offset-inline-start
offset-inline-start.desc: Logical 'left'. Mapping depends on the parent element’s 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

values.name: auto
values.desc: For non-replaced elements, the effect of this value depends on which of related properties have the value 'auto' as well.

outline.name: outline
outline.desc: A shorthand property for the outline-width, outline-style, and the outline-color properties

values.name: auto
values.desc: Permits the user agent to render a custom outline style, typically the default platform style.

outline-color.name: outline-color
outline-color.desc: Sets the color of an outline

outline-offset.name: outline-offset
outline-offset.desc: Offsets an outline, and draws it beyond the border edge

outline-style.name: outline-style
outline-style.desc: Sets the style of an outline

values.name: auto
values.desc: Permits the user agent to render a custom outline style, typically the default platform style.
Permits the user agent to render a custom outline style.

outline-width.name: outline-width
outline-width.desc: Sets the width of an outline

values.name: thin
values.desc: Depends on the user agent. Typically equivalent to 1px in desktop browsers (including Firefox).

values.name: medium
values.desc: Depends on the user agent. Typically equivalent to 3px in desktop browsers (including Firefox).

values.name: thick
values.desc: Depends on the user agent. Typically equivalent to 5px in desktop browsers (including Firefox).

values.name: auto
values.desc: The behavior of the 'auto' value is UA-dependent, but should cause a scrolling mechanism to be provided for overflowing boxes.

values.name: hidden
values.desc: Content is clipped and no scrolling mechanism should be provided to view the content outside the clipping region.

values.name: scroll
values.desc: Content is clipped and if the user agent uses a scrolling mechanism that is visible on the screen (such as a scroll bar or a panner), that mechanism should be displayed for a box whether or not any of its content is clipped.

values.name: visible
values.desc: Content is not clipped, i.e., it may be rendered outside the content box.

values.name: clip
values.desc: Like for hidden, the content is clipped to the element's padding box. The difference between clip and hidden is that the clip keyword also forbids all scrolling, including programmatic scrolling. The box is not a scroll container, and does not start a new formatting context. If you wish to start a new formatting context, you can use display: flow-root to do so.

overflow-wrap.name: overflow-wrap
overflow-wrap.desc: Specifies whether or not the browser may break lines within words in order to prevent overflow (when a string is too long to fit its containing box)

values.name: break-word
values.desc: An otherwise unbreakable sequence of characters may be broken at an arbitrary point if there are no otherwise-acceptable break points in the line.

values.name: normal
values.desc: Lines may break only at allowed break points.

values.name: anywhere
values.desc: To prevent overflow, an otherwise unbreakable string of characters — like a long word or URL — may be broken at any point if there are no otherwise-acceptable break points in the line. No hyphenation character is inserted at the break point. Soft wrap opportunities introduced by the word break are considered when calculating min-content intrinsic sizes.

overflow-x.name: overflow-x
overflow-x.desc: Specifies whether or not to clip the left/right edges of the content, if it overflows the element's content area

values.name: auto
values.desc: The behavior of the 'auto' value is UA-dependent, but should cause a scrolling mechanism to be provided for overflowing boxes.

values.name: hidden
values.desc: Content is clipped and no scrolling mechanism should be provided to view the content outside the clipping region.

values.name: scroll
values.desc: Content is clipped and if the user agent uses a scrolling mechanism that is visible on the screen (such as a scroll bar or a panner), that mechanism should be displayed for a box whether or not any of its content is clipped.

values.name: visible
values.desc: Content is not clipped, i.e., it may be rendered outside the content box.

values.name: clip
values.desc: Like for hidden, the content is clipped to the element's padding box. The difference between clip and hidden is that the clip keyword also forbids all scrolling, including programmatic scrolling. The box is not a scroll container, and does not start a new formatting context. If you wish to start a new formatting context, you can use display: flow-root to do so.

overflow-y.name: overflow-y
overflow-y.desc: Specifies whether or not to clip the top/bottom edges of the content, if it overflows the element's content area

values.name: auto
values.desc: The behavior of the 'auto' value is UA-dependent, but should cause a scrolling mechanism to be provided for overflowing boxes.

values.name: hidden
values.desc: Content is clipped and no scrolling mechanism should be provided to view the content outside the clipping region.

values.name: scroll
values.desc: Content is clipped and if the user agent uses a scrolling mechanism that is visible on the screen (such as a scroll bar or a panner), that mechanism should be displayed for a box whether or not any of its content is clipped.

values.name: visible
values.desc: Content is not clipped, i.e., it may be rendered outside the content box.

values.name: clip
values.desc: Like for hidden, the content is clipped to the element's padding box. The difference between clip and hidden is that the clip keyword also forbids all scrolling, including programmatic scrolling. The box is not a scroll container, and does not start a new formatting context. If you wish to start a new formatting context, you can use display: flow-root to do so.

pad.name: pad
pad.desc: @counter-style descriptor. Specifies a “fixed-width” counter style, where representations shorter than the pad value are padded with a particular <symbol>

padding.name: padding
padding.desc: A shorthand property for all the padding-* properties

padding-bottom.name: padding-bottom
padding-bottom.desc: Sets the bottom padding of an element

padding-block-end.name: padding-block-end
padding-block-end.desc: Logical 'padding-bottom'. Mapping depends on the parent element’s 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

padding-block-start.name: padding-block-start
padding-block-start.desc: Logical 'padding-top'. Mapping depends on the parent element’s 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

padding-inline-end.name: padding-inline-end
padding-inline-end.desc: Logical 'padding-right'. Mapping depends on the parent element’s 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

padding-inline-start.name: padding-inline-start
padding-inline-start.desc: Logical 'padding-left'. Mapping depends on the parent element’s 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

padding-left.name: padding-left
padding-left.desc: Sets the left padding of an element

padding-right.name: padding-right
padding-right.desc: Sets the right padding of an element

padding-top.name: padding-top
padding-top.desc: Sets the top padding of an element

page-break-after.name: page-break-after
page-break-after.desc: Sets the page-break behavior after an element

values.name: always
values.desc: Always force a page break after the generated box.

values.name: auto
values.desc: Neither force nor forbid a page break after generated box.

values.name: avoid
values.desc: Avoid a page break after the generated box.

values.name: left
values.desc: Force one or two page breaks after the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a left page.

values.name: right
values.desc: Force one or two page breaks after the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a right page.

values.name: recto
values.desc: If pages progress left-to-right, then this acts like right. If pages progress right-to-left, then this acts like left.

values.name: verso
values.desc: If pages progress left-to-right, then this acts like left. If pages progress right-to-left, then this acts like right.

page-break-before.name: page-break-before
page-break-before.desc: Sets the page-break behavior before an element

values.name: always
values.desc: Always force a page break before the generated box.

values.name: auto
values.desc: Neither force nor forbid a page break before the generated box.

values.name: avoid
values.desc: Avoid a page break before the generated box.

values.name: left
values.desc: Force one or two page breaks before the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a left page.

values.name: right
values.desc: Force one or two page breaks before the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a right page.

values.name: recto
values.desc: If pages progress left-to-right, then this acts like right. If pages progress right-to-left, then this acts like left.

values.name: verso
values.desc: If pages progress left-to-right, then this acts like left. If pages progress right-to-left, then this acts like right.

page-break-inside.name: page-break-inside
page-break-inside.desc: Sets the page-break behavior inside an element

values.name: auto
values.desc: Neither force nor forbid a page break inside the generated box.

values.name: avoid
values.desc: Avoid a page break inside the generated box.

paint-order.name: paint-order
paint-order.desc: Controls the order that the three paint operations that shapes and text are rendered with: their fill, their stroke and any markers they might have.

values.name: normal
values.desc: The element is painted with the standard order of painting operations: the 'fill' is painted first, then its 'stroke' and finally its markers.

values.name: stroke,
values.desc: Specify some or all of these values in the order you want them to be painted in.

values.name: none
values.desc: No perspective transform is applied.

perspective-origin.name: perspective-origin
perspective-origin.desc: Defines at which position the user is looking at the 3D-positioned element

values.name: x-position
values.desc: Indicates the position of the abscissa of the vanishing point. It can have one of the following values: <length-percentage> indicating the position as an absolute length value or relative to the width of the element. The value may be negative.left, a keyword being a shortcut for the 0 length value.center, a keyword being a shortcut for the 50% percentage value.right, a keyword being a shortcut for the 100% percentage value.

values.name: y-position
values.desc: Indicates the position of the ordinate of the vanishing point. It can have one of the following values: <length-percentage> indicating the position as an absolute length value or relative to the height of the element. The value may be negative.top, a keyword being a shortcut for the 0 length value.center, a keyword being a shortcut for the 50% percentage value.bottom, a keyword being a shortcut for the 100% percentage value.

pointer-events.name: pointer-events
pointer-events.desc: Defines whether or not an element reacts to pointer events

values.name: all
values.desc: The given element can be the target element for pointer events whenever the pointer is over either the interior or the perimeter of the element.

values.name: fill
values.desc: The given element can be the target element for pointer events whenever the pointer is over the interior of the element.

values.name: none
values.desc: The given element does not receive pointer events.

values.name: stroke
values.desc: The given element can be the target element for pointer events whenever the pointer is over the perimeter of the element.

values.name: visible
values.desc: The given element can be the target element for pointer events when the ‘visibility’ property is set to visible and the pointer is over either the interior or the perimete of the element.

values.name: auto
values.desc: The element behaves as it would if the pointer-events property were not specified. In SVG content, this value and the value visiblePainted have the same effect.

position.name: position

values.name: fixed
values.desc: The box's position is calculated according to the 'absolute' model, but in addition, the box is fixed with respect to some reference. As with the 'absolute' model, the box's margins do not collapse with any other margins.

position.desc: Specifies the type of positioning method used for an element (static, relative, absolute or fixed)

prefix.name: prefix
prefix.desc: @counter-style descriptor. Specifies a <symbol> that is prepended to the marker representation.

quotes.name: quotes
quotes.desc: Sets the type of quotation marks for embedded quotations

values.name: none
values.desc: The 'open-quote' and 'close-quote' values of the 'content' property produce no quotations marks, as if they were 'no-open-quote' and 'no-close-quote' respectively.

values.name: auto
values.desc: Appropriate quote marks will be used for whatever language value is set on the selected elements (i.e. via the lang attribute).

range.name: range
range.desc: @counter-style descriptor. Defines the ranges over which the counter style is defined.

values.name: auto
values.desc: The range depends on the counter system.

values.name: infinite
values.desc: If used as the first value in a range, it represents negative infinity; if used as the second value, it represents positive infinity.

resize.name: resize
resize.desc: Defines if (and how) an element is resizable by the user

values.name: both
values.desc: The UA presents a bidirectional resizing mechanism to allow the user to adjust both the height and the width of the element.

values.name: horizontal
values.desc: The UA presents a unidirectional horizontal resizing mechanism to allow the user to adjust only the width of the element.

values.name: none
values.desc: The UA does not present a resizing mechanism on the element, and the user is given no direct manipulation mechanism to resize the element.

values.name: vertical
values.desc: The UA presents a unidirectional vertical resizing mechanism to allow the user to adjust only the height of the element.

values.name: block
values.desc: The element displays a mechanism for allowing the user to resize it in the block direction (either horizontally or vertically, depending on the writing-mode and direction value).

values.name: inline
values.desc: The element displays a mechanism for allowing the user to resize it in the inline direction (either horizontally or vertically, depending on the writing-mode and direction value).

right.name: right
right.desc: Specifies the right position of a positioned element

values.name: auto
values.desc: For non-replaced elements, the effect of this value depends on which of related properties have the value 'auto' as well

values.name: inherit
values.desc: Specifies that the value is the same as the computed value from its parent element (which might not be its containing block). This computed value is then handled as if it were a <length>, <percentage>, or the auto keyword.

ruby-align.name: ruby-align
ruby-align.desc: Specifies how text is distributed within the various ruby boxes when their contents do not exactly fill their respective boxes.

values.name: auto
values.desc: The user agent determines how the ruby contents are aligned. This is the initial value.

values.name: center
values.desc: The ruby content is centered within its box.

values.name: left
values.desc: The ruby text content is aligned with the start edge of the base.

values.name: right
values.desc: The ruby text content is aligned with the end edge of the base.

values.name: start
values.desc: The ruby text content is aligned with the start edge of the base.

values.name: space-between
values.desc: The ruby content expands as defined for normal text justification (as defined by 'text-justify'),

values.name: space-around
values.desc: As for 'space-between' except that there exists an extra justification opportunities whose space is distributed half before and half after the ruby content.

ruby-overhang.name: ruby-overhang
ruby-overhang.desc: Determines whether, and on which side, ruby text is allowed to partially overhang any adjacent text in addition to its own base, when the ruby text is wider than the ruby base.

values.name: auto
values.desc: The ruby text can overhang text adjacent to the base on either side. This is the initial value.

values.name: end
values.desc: The ruby text can overhang the text that follows it.

values.name: none
values.desc: The ruby text cannot overhang any text adjacent to its base, only its own base.

values.name: start
values.desc: The ruby text can overhang the text that precedes it.

ruby-position.name: ruby-position
ruby-position.desc: Used by the parent of elements with display: ruby-text to control the position of the ruby text with respect to its base.

values.name: right
values.desc: The ruby text appears on the right of the base. Unlike 'before' and 'after', this value is not relative to the text flow direction.

values.name: over
values.desc: Is a keyword indicating that the ruby has to be placed over the main text for horizontal scripts and right to it for vertical scripts.

values.name: under
values.desc: Is a keyword indicating that the ruby has to be placed under the main text for horizontal scripts and left to it for vertical scripts.

values.name: inter-character
values.desc: Is a keyword indicating that the ruby has to be placed between the different characters.

ruby-span.name: ruby-span
ruby-span.desc: Determines whether, and on which side, ruby text is allowed to partially overhang any adjacent text in addition to its own base, when the ruby text is wider than the ruby base.

values.name: none
values.desc: No spanning. The computed value is '1'.

scrollbar-3dlight-color.name: scrollbar-3dlight-color
scrollbar-3dlight-color.desc: Determines the color of the top and left edges of the scroll box and scroll arrows of a scroll bar.

scrollbar-arrow-color.name: scrollbar-arrow-color
scrollbar-arrow-color.desc: Determines the color of the arrow elements of a scroll arrow.

scrollbar-base-color.name: scrollbar-base-color
scrollbar-base-color.desc: Determines the color of the main elements of a scroll bar, which include the scroll box, track, and scroll arrows.

scrollbar-darkshadow-color.name: scrollbar-darkshadow-color
scrollbar-darkshadow-color.desc: Determines the color of the gutter of a scroll bar.

scrollbar-face-color.name: scrollbar-face-color
scrollbar-face-color.desc: Determines the color of the scroll box and scroll arrows of a scroll bar.

scrollbar-highlight-color.name: scrollbar-highlight-color
scrollbar-highlight-color.desc: Determines the color of the top and left edges of the scroll box and scroll arrows of a scroll bar.

scrollbar-shadow-color.name: scrollbar-shadow-color
scrollbar-shadow-color.desc: Determines the color of the bottom and right edges of the scroll box and scroll arrows of a scroll bar.

scrollbar-track-color.name: scrollbar-track-color
scrollbar-track-color.desc: Determines the color of the track element of a scroll bar.

scroll-behavior.name: scroll-behavior
scroll-behavior.desc: Specifies whether to smoothly animate the scroll position in a scrollable box, instead of a straight jump

values.name: auto
values.desc: Scrolls in an instant fashion.

scroll-snap-coordinate.name: scroll-snap-coordinate
scroll-snap-coordinate.desc: Defines the x and y coordinate within the element which will align with the nearest ancestor scroll container’s snap-destination for the respective axis.

values.name: none
values.desc: Specifies that this element does not contribute a snap point.

scroll-snap-destination.name: scroll-snap-destination
scroll-snap-destination.desc: Define the x and y coordinate within the scroll container’s visual viewport which element snap points will align with.

scroll-snap-points-x.name: scroll-snap-points-x
scroll-snap-points-x.desc: Defines the positioning of snap points along the x axis of the scroll container it is applied to.

values.name: none
values.desc: No snap points are defined by this scroll container.

values.name: repeat()
values.desc: Defines an interval at which snap points are defined, starting from the container’s relevant start edge.

values.name: repeat(<length-percentage>)
values.desc: Defines an interval at which snap points are defined, starting from the container's relevant start edge. Only positive lengths are allowed. Percentages refer to the width of the container.

scroll-snap-points-y.name: scroll-snap-points-y
scroll-snap-points-y.desc: Defines the positioning of snap points alobg the y axis of the scroll container it is applied to.

values.name: none
values.desc: No snap points are defined by this scroll container.

values.name: repeat()
values.desc: Defines an interval at which snap points are defined, starting from the container’s relevant start edge.

values.name: repeat(<length-percentage>)
values.desc: Defines an interval at which snap points are defined, starting from the container's relevant start edge. Only positive lengths are allowed. Percentages refer to the width of the container.

scroll-snap-type.name: scroll-snap-type
scroll-snap-type.desc: Defines how strictly snap points are enforced on the scroll container.

values.name: none
values.desc: The visual viewport of this scroll container must ignore snap points, if any, when scrolled.

values.name: mandatory
values.desc: The visual viewport of this scroll container is guaranteed to rest on a snap point when there are no active scrolling operations.

values.name: proximity
values.desc: The visual viewport of this scroll container may come to rest on a snap point at the termination of a scroll at the discretion of the UA given the parameters of the scroll.

values.name: x
values.desc: The scroll container snaps to snap positions in its horizontal axis only.

values.name: y
values.desc: The scroll container snaps to snap positions in its vertical axis only.

values.name: block
values.desc: The scroll container snaps to snap positions in its block axis only.

values.name: inline
values.desc: The scroll container snaps to snap positions in its inline axis only.

values.name: both
values.desc: The scroll container snaps to snap positions in both of its axes independently (potentially snapping to different elements in each axis).

shape-image-threshold.name: shape-image-threshold
shape-image-threshold.desc: Defines the alpha channel threshold used to extract the shape using an image. A value of 0.5 means that the shape will enclose all the pixels that are more than 50% opaque.

shape-margin.name: shape-margin
shape-margin.desc: Adds a margin to a 'shape-outside'. This defines a new shape that is the smallest contour that includes all the points that are the 'shape-margin' distance outward in the perpendicular direction from a point on the underlying shape.

shape-outside.name: shape-outside
shape-outside.desc: Specifies an orthogonal rotation to be applied to an image before it is laid out.

values.name: none
values.desc: The float area is unaffected.

shape-rendering.name: shape-rendering
shape-rendering.desc: Provides hints about what tradeoffs to make as it renders vector graphics elements such as <path> elements and basic shapes such as circles and rectangles.

values.name: auto
values.desc: Suppresses aural rendering.

values.name: geometricPrecision
values.desc: Emphasize geometric precision over speed and crisp edges.

values.name: optimizeSpeed
values.desc: Emphasize rendering speed over geometric precision and crisp edges.

src.name: src
src.desc: @font-face descriptor. Specifies the resource containing font data. It is required, whether the font is downloadable or locally installed.

values.name: url()
values.desc: Reference font by URL

stop-color.name: stop-color
stop-color.desc: Indicates what color to use at that gradient stop.

stop-opacity.name: stop-opacity
stop-opacity.desc: Defines the opacity of a given gradient stop.

stroke.name: stroke
stroke.desc: Paints along the outline of the given graphical element.

values.name: url()
values.desc: A URL reference to a paint server element, which is an element that defines a paint server: ‘hatch’, ‘linearGradient’, ‘mesh’, ‘pattern’, ‘radialGradient’ and ‘solidcolor’.

stroke-dasharray.name: stroke-dasharray
stroke-dasharray.desc: Controls the pattern of dashes and gaps used to stroke paths.

values.name: none
values.desc: Indicates that no dashing is used.

stroke-dashoffset.name: stroke-dashoffset
stroke-dashoffset.desc: Specifies the distance into the dash pattern to start the dash.

stroke-linecap.name: stroke-linecap
stroke-linecap.desc: Specifies the shape to be used at the end of open subpaths when they are stroked.

values.name: round
values.desc: Indicates that at each end of each subpath, the shape representing the stroke will be extended by a half circle with a radius equal to the stroke width.

values.name: square
values.desc: Indicates that at the end of each subpath, the shape representing the stroke will be extended by a rectangle with the same width as the stroke width and whose length is half of the stroke width.

stroke-linejoin.name: stroke-linejoin
stroke-linejoin.desc: Specifies the shape to be used at the corners of paths or basic shapes when they are stroked.

values.name: round
values.desc: Indicates that a round corner is to be used to join path segments.

stroke-miterlimit.name: stroke-miterlimit
stroke-miterlimit.desc: When two line segments meet at a sharp angle and miter joins have been specified for 'stroke-linejoin', it is possible for the miter to extend far beyond the thickness of the line stroking the path.

stroke-opacity.name: stroke-opacity
stroke-opacity.desc: Specifies the opacity of the painting operation used to stroke the current object.

stroke-width.name: stroke-width
stroke-width.desc: Specifies the width of the stroke on the current object.

suffix.name: suffix
suffix.desc: @counter-style descriptor. Specifies a <symbol> that is appended to the marker representation.

system.name: system
system.desc: @counter-style descriptor. Specifies which algorithm will be used to construct the counter’s representation based on the counter value.

values.name: alphabetic
values.desc: Interprets the list of counter symbols as digits to an alphabetic numbering system, similar to the default lower-alpha counter style, which wraps from "a", "b", "c", to "aa", "ab", "ac".

values.name: fixed
values.desc: Runs through its list of counter symbols once, then falls back.

symbols.name: symbols
symbols.desc: @counter-style descriptor. Specifies the symbols used by the marker-construction algorithm specified by the system descriptor.

table-layout.name: table-layout
table-layout.desc: Defines the algorithm used to lay out table cells, rows, and columns

values.name: auto
values.desc: Use any automatic table layout algorithm.

values.name: fixed
values.desc: Use the fixed table layout algorithm.

tab-size.name: tab-size
tab-size.desc: Specifies the width of a tab character

text-align.name: text-align
text-align.desc: Specifies the horizontal alignment of text

values.name: center
values.desc: The inline contents are centered within the line box.

values.name: end
values.desc: The inline contents are aligned to the end edge of the line box.

values.name: justify
values.desc: The text is justified according to the method specified by the 'text-justify' property.

values.name: left
values.desc: The inline contents are aligned to the left edge of the line box. In vertical text, 'left' aligns to the edge of the line box that would be the start edge for left-to-right text.

values.name: right
values.desc: The inline contents are aligned to the right edge of the line box. In vertical text, 'right' aligns to the edge of the line box that would be the end edge for left-to-right text.

values.name: start
values.desc: The inline contents are aligned to the start edge of the line box.

values.name: justify-all
values.desc: Same as justify, but also forces the last line to be justified.

values.name: match-parent
values.desc: Similar to inherit, but the values start and end are calculated according to the parent's direction and are replaced by the appropriate left or right value.

text-align-last.name: text-align-last
text-align-last.desc: Describes how the last line of a block or a line right before a forced line break is aligned when text-align is "justify"

values.name: auto
values.desc: Content on the affected line is aligned per 'text-align' unless 'text-align' is set to 'justify', in which case it is 'start-aligned'.

values.name: center
values.desc: The inline contents are centered within the line box.

values.name: justify
values.desc: The text is justified according to the method specified by the 'text-justify' property.

values.name: left
values.desc: The inline contents are aligned to the left edge of the line box. In vertical text, 'left' aligns to the edge of the line box that would be the start edge for left-to-right text.

values.name: right
values.desc: The inline contents are aligned to the right edge of the line box. In vertical text, 'right' aligns to the edge of the line box that would be the end edge for left-to-right text.

values.name: start
values.desc: The same as left if direction is left-to-right and right if direction is right-to-left.

values.name: end
values.desc: The same as right if direction is left-to-right and left if direction is right-to-left.

text-anchor.name: text-anchor
text-anchor.desc: Used to align (start-, middle- or end-alignment) a string of text relative to a given point.

values.name: end
values.desc: The rendered characters are aligned such that the end of the resulting rendered text is at the initial current text position.

values.name: middle
values.desc: The rendered characters are aligned such that the geometric middle of the resulting rendered text is at the initial current text position.

values.name: start
values.desc: The rendered characters are aligned such that the start of the resulting rendered text is at the initial current text position.

text-decoration.name: text-decoration
text-decoration.desc: Specifies the decoration added to text

text-decoration-color.name: text-decoration-color
text-decoration-color.desc: Specifies the color of the text-decoration

text-decoration-line.name: text-decoration-line
text-decoration-line.desc: Specifies the type of line in a text-decoration

values.name: none
values.desc: Neither produces nor inhibits text decoration.

values.name: blink
values.desc: The text blinks (alternates between visible and invisible). Conforming user agents may simply not blink the text. This value is deprecated in favor of CSS animations.

text-decoration-style.name: text-decoration-style
text-decoration-style.desc: Specifies the style of the line in a text decoration

values.name: none
values.desc: Produces no line.

values.name: -moz-none
values.desc: Draws no line. Use text-decoration-line: none instead.

text-indent.name: text-indent
text-indent.desc: Specifies the indentation of the first line in a text-block

values.name: each-line
values.desc: Indentation affects the first line of the block container as well as each line after a forced line break, but does not affect lines after a soft wrap break.

values.name: hanging
values.desc: Inverts which lines are indented. All lines except the first line will be indented.

text-justify.name: text-justify
text-justify.desc: Specifies the justification method used when text-align is "justify"

values.name: auto
values.desc: The UA determines the justification algorithm to follow, based on a balance between performance and adequate presentation quality.

values.name: distribute
values.desc: Justification primarily changes spacing both at word separators and at grapheme cluster boundaries in all scripts except those in the connected and cursive groups. This value is sometimes used in e.g. Japanese, often with the 'text-align-last' property.

values.name: none
values.desc: The text justification is turned off. This has the same effect as not setting text-align at all, although it is useful if you need to turn justification on and off for some reason.

values.name: inter-character
values.desc: The text is justified by adding space between characters (effectively varying letter-spacing), which is most appropriate for languages like Japanese.

text-orientation.name: text-orientation
text-orientation.desc: Defines the orientation of the text in a line

values.name: mixed
values.desc: Rotates the characters of horizontal scripts 90° clockwise. Lays out the characters of vertical scripts naturally. Default value.

values.name: use-glyph-orientation
values.desc: On SVG elements, this keyword leads to use the value of the deprecated SVG properties glyph-orientation-vertical and glyph-orientation-horizontal.

text-overflow.name: text-overflow
text-overflow.desc: Specifies what should happen when text overflows the containing element

values.name: fade
values.desc: This keyword clips the overflowing inline content and applies a fade-out effect near the edge of the line box with complete transparency at the edge.

values.name: fade( <length> | <percentage> )
values.desc: This function clips the overflowing inline content and applies a fade-out effect near the edge of the line box with complete transparency at the edge.

text-rendering.name: text-rendering
text-rendering.desc: The creator of SVG content might want to provide a hint to the implementation about what tradeoffs to make as it renders text. The ‘text-rendering’ property provides these hints.

values.name: geometricPrecision
values.desc: Indicates that the user agent shall emphasize geometric precision over legibility and rendering speed.

values.name: optimizeSpeed
values.desc: Indicates that the user agent shall emphasize rendering speed over legibility and geometric precision.

values.name: none
values.desc: No effects.

text-underline-position.name: text-underline-position
