text-underline-position.desc: Specifies the position of the underline which is set using the text-decoration property

values.name: auto
values.desc: The user agent may use any algorithm to determine the underline’s position. In horizontal line layout, the underline should be aligned as for alphabetic. In vertical line layout, if the language is set to Japanese or Korean, the underline should be aligned as for over.

values.name: below
values.desc: The underline is aligned with the under edge of the element’s content box.

values.name: under
values.desc: Forces the line to be set below the alphabetic baseline, at a position where it won't cross any descenders. This is useful for ensuring legibility with chemical and mathematical formulas, which make a large use of subscripts.

values.name: left
values.desc: In vertical writing-modes, this keyword forces the line to be placed on the left side of the text. In horizontal writing-modes, it is a synonym of under.

values.name: right
values.desc: In vertical writing-modes, this keyword forces the line to be placed on the right side of the text. In horizontal writing-modes, it is a synonym of under.

values.name: auto-pos
values.desc: A synonym of auto, which should be used instead.

top.name: top
top.desc: Specifies the top position of a positioned element

values.name: auto
values.desc: For non-replaced elements, the effect of this value depends on which of related properties have the value 'auto' as well

values.name: inherit
values.desc: Specifies that the value is the same as the computed value from its parent element (which might not be its containing block). This computed value is then handled as if it were a <length>, <percentage>, or the auto keyword.

touch-action.name: touch-action
touch-action.desc: Determines whether touch input may trigger default behavior supplied by user agent.

values.name: auto
values.desc: The user agent may determine any permitted touch behaviors for touches that begin on the element.

values.name: manipulation
values.desc: The user agent may consider touches that begin on the element only for the purposes of scrolling and continuous zooming.

values.name: none
values.desc: Touches that begin on the element must not trigger default touch behaviors.

values.name: pan-x
values.desc: The user agent may consider touches that begin on the element only for the purposes of horizontally scrolling the element’s nearest ancestor with horizontally scrollable content.

values.name: pan-y
values.desc: The user agent may consider touches that begin on the element only for the purposes of vertically scrolling the element’s nearest ancestor with vertically scrollable content.

transform.name: transform
transform.desc: Applies a 2D or 3D transformation to an element

transform-origin.name: transform-origin
transform-origin.desc: Allows you to change the position on transformed elements

values.name: x-offset
values.desc: Is a <length> or a <percentage> describing how far from the left edge of the box the origin of the transform is set.

values.name: offset-keyword
values.desc: Is one of the left, right, top, bottom, or center keyword describing the corresponding offset.

values.name: y-offset
values.desc: Is a <length> or a <percentage> describing how far from the top edge of the box the origin of the transform is set.

values.name: x-offset-keyword
values.desc: Is one of the left, right, or center keyword describing how far from the left edge of the box the origin of the transform is set.

values.name: y-offset-keyword
values.desc: Is one of the top, bottom, or center keyword describing how far from the top edge of the box the origin of the transform is set.

values.name: z-offset
values.desc: Is a <length> (and never a <percentage> which would make the statement invalid) describing how far from the user eye the z=0 origin is set.

transform-style.name: transform-style
transform-style.desc: Specifies how nested elements are rendered in 3D space

transition.name: transition
transition.desc: A shorthand property for all the transition-* properties

values.name: all
values.desc: Every property that is able to undergo a transition will do so.

values.name: none
values.desc: No property will transition.

transition-delay.name: transition-delay
transition-delay.desc: Specifies when the transition effect will start

transition-duration.name: transition-duration
transition-duration.desc: Specifies how many seconds or milliseconds a transition effect takes to complete

transition-property.name: transition-property
transition-property.desc: Specifies the name of the CSS property the transition effect is for

values.name: all
values.desc: Every property that is able to undergo a transition will do so.

values.name: none
values.desc: No property will transition.

transition-timing-function.name: transition-timing-function
transition-timing-function.desc: Specifies the speed curve of the transition effect

unicode-bidi.name: unicode-bidi
unicode-bidi.desc: Used together with the direction property to set or return whether the text should be overridden to support multiple languages in the same document

values.name: isolate
values.desc: The contents of the element are considered to be inside a separate, independent paragraph.

values.name: normal
values.desc: The element does not open an additional level of embedding with respect to the bidirectional algorithm. For inline-level elements, implicit reordering works across element boundaries.

unicode-range.name: unicode-range
unicode-range.desc: @font-face descriptor. Defines the set of Unicode codepoints that may be supported by the font face for which it is declared.

user-select.name: user-select
user-select.desc: Specifies whether the text of an element can be selected

values.name: all
values.desc: The content of the element must be selected atomically

values.name: contain
values.desc: UAs must not allow a selection which is started in this element to be extended outside of this element.

values.name: none
values.desc: The UA must not allow selections to be started in this element.

values.name: text
values.desc: The element imposes no constraint on the selection.

vertical-align.name: vertical-align
vertical-align.desc: Sets the vertical alignment of an element

values.name: auto
values.desc: Align the dominant baseline of the parent box with the equivalent, or heuristically reconstructed, baseline of the element inline box.

values.name: baseline
values.desc: Align the 'alphabetic' baseline of the element with the 'alphabetic' baseline of the parent element.

values.name: bottom
values.desc: Align the after edge of the extended inline box with the after-edge of the line box.

values.name: middle
values.desc: Align the 'middle' baseline of the inline element with the middle baseline of the parent.

values.name: sub
values.desc: Lower the baseline of the box to the proper position for subscripts of the parent's box. (This value has no effect on the font size of the element's text.)

values.name: super
values.desc: Raise the baseline of the box to the proper position for superscripts of the parent's box. (This value has no effect on the font size of the element's text.)

values.name: top
values.desc: Align the before edge of the extended inline box with the before-edge of the line box.

visibility.name: visibility
visibility.desc: Specifies whether or not an element is visible

values.name: collapse
values.desc: Table-specific. If used on elements other than rows, row groups, columns, or column groups, 'collapse' has the same meaning as 'hidden'.

values.name: hidden
values.desc: The generated box is invisible (fully transparent, nothing is drawn), but still affects layout.

values.name: visible
values.desc: The generated box is visible.

-webkit-animation.name: -webkit-animation
-webkit-animation.desc: Shorthand property combines six of the animation properties into a single property.

values.name: both
values.desc: Both forwards and backwards fill modes are applied.

values.name: infinite
values.desc: Causes the animation to repeat forever.

values.name: none
values.desc: No animation is performed

values.name: normal
values.desc: Normal playback.

values.name: reverse
values.desc: All iterations of the animation are played in the reverse direction from the way they were specified.

-webkit-animation-delay.name: -webkit-animation-delay
-webkit-animation-delay.desc: Defines when the animation will start.

-webkit-animation-direction.name: -webkit-animation-direction
-webkit-animation-direction.desc: Defines whether or not the animation should play in reverse on alternate cycles.

values.name: normal
values.desc: Normal playback.

values.name: reverse
values.desc: All iterations of the animation are played in the reverse direction from the way they were specified.

-webkit-animation-duration.name: -webkit-animation-duration
-webkit-animation-duration.desc: Defines the length of time that an animation takes to complete one cycle.

-webkit-animation-fill-mode.name: -webkit-animation-fill-mode
-webkit-animation-fill-mode.desc: Defines what values are applied by the animation outside the time it is executing.

values.name: both
values.desc: Both forwards and backwards fill modes are applied.

values.name: none
values.desc: There is no change to the property value between the time the animation is applied and the time the animation begins playing or after the animation completes.

-webkit-animation-iteration-count.name: -webkit-animation-iteration-count
-webkit-animation-iteration-count.desc: Defines the number of times an animation cycle is played. The default value is one, meaning the animation will play from beginning to end once.

values.name: infinite
values.desc: Causes the animation to repeat forever.

-webkit-animation-name.name: -webkit-animation-name
-webkit-animation-name.desc: Defines a list of animations that apply. Each name is used to select the keyframe at-rule that provides the property values for the animation.

values.name: none
values.desc: No animation is performed

-webkit-animation-play-state.name: -webkit-animation-play-state
-webkit-animation-play-state.desc: Defines whether the animation is running or paused.

-webkit-animation-timing-function.name: -webkit-animation-timing-function
-webkit-animation-timing-function.desc: Describes how the animation will progress over one cycle of its duration. See the 'transition-timing-function'.

-webkit-appearance.name: -webkit-appearance
-webkit-appearance.desc: Changes the appearance of buttons and other controls to resemble native controls.

-webkit-backdrop-filter.name: -webkit-backdrop-filter
-webkit-backdrop-filter.desc: Applies a filter effect where the first filter in the list takes the element's background image as the input image.

values.name: none
values.desc: No filter effects are applied.

values.name: url()
values.desc: A filter reference to a <filter> element.

-webkit-backface-visibility.name: -webkit-backface-visibility
-webkit-backface-visibility.desc: Determines whether or not the 'back' side of a transformed element is visible when facing the viewer. With an identity transform, the front side of an element faces the viewer.

-webkit-background-origin.name: -webkit-background-origin
-webkit-background-origin.desc: For elements rendered as a single box, specifies the background positioning area. For elements rendered as multiple boxes (e.g., inline boxes on several lines, boxes on several pages) specifies which boxes 'box-decoration-break' operates on to determine the background positioning area(s).

-webkit-border-image.name: -webkit-border-image
-webkit-border-image.desc: Shorthand property for setting 'border-image-source', 'border-image-slice', 'border-image-width', 'border-image-outset' and 'border-image-repeat'. Omitted values are set to their initial values.

values.name: auto
values.desc: If 'auto' is specified then the border image width is the intrinsic width or height (whichever is applicable) of the corresponding image slice. If the image does not have the required intrinsic dimension then the corresponding border-width is used instead.

values.name: fill
values.desc: Causes the middle part of the border-image to be preserved.

values.name: round
values.desc: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the image is rescaled so that it does.

values.name: space
values.desc: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the extra space is distributed around the tiles.

values.name: stretch
values.desc: The image is stretched to fill the area.

-webkit-box-align.name: -webkit-box-align
-webkit-box-align.desc: Specifies the alignment of nested elements within an outer flexible box element.

values.name: baseline
values.desc: If this box orientation is inline-axis or horizontal, all children are placed with their baselines aligned, and extra space placed before or after as necessary. For block flows, the baseline of the first non-empty line box located within the element is used. For tables, the baseline of the first cell is used.

values.name: center
values.desc: Any extra space is divided evenly, with half placed above the child and the other half placed after the child.

values.name: end
values.desc: For normal direction boxes, the bottom edge of each child is placed along the bottom of the box. Extra space is placed above the element. For reverse direction boxes, the top edge of each child is placed along the top of the box. Extra space is placed below the element.

values.name: start
values.desc: For normal direction boxes, the top edge of each child is placed along the top of the box. Extra space is placed below the element. For reverse direction boxes, the bottom edge of each child is placed along the bottom of the box. Extra space is placed above the element.

values.name: stretch
values.desc: The height of each child is adjusted to that of the containing block.

-webkit-box-direction.name: -webkit-box-direction
-webkit-box-direction.desc: In webkit applications, -webkit-box-direction specifies whether a box lays out its contents normally (from the top or left edge), or in reverse (from the bottom or right edge).

values.name: normal
values.desc: A box with a computed value of horizontal for box-orient displays its children from left to right. A box with a computed value of vertical displays its children from top to bottom.

values.name: reverse
values.desc: A box with a computed value of horizontal for box-orient displays its children from right to left. A box with a computed value of vertical displays its children from bottom to top.

-webkit-box-flex-group.name: -webkit-box-flex-group
-webkit-box-flex-group.desc: Flexible elements can be assigned to flex groups using the 'box-flex-group' property.

-webkit-box-ordinal-group.name: -webkit-box-ordinal-group
-webkit-box-ordinal-group.desc: Indicates the ordinal group the element belongs to. Elements with a lower ordinal group are displayed before those with a higher ordinal group.

-webkit-box-orient.name: -webkit-box-orient
-webkit-box-orient.desc: In webkit applications, -webkit-box-orient specifies whether a box lays out its contents horizontally or vertically.

values.name: horizontal
values.desc: The box displays its children from left to right in a horizontal line.

values.name: vertical
values.desc: The box displays its children from stacked from top to bottom vertically.

-webkit-box-pack.name: -webkit-box-pack
-webkit-box-pack.desc: Specifies alignment of child elements within the current element in the direction of orientation.

values.name: center
values.desc: The extra space is divided evenly, with half placed before the first child and the other half placed after the last child.

values.name: end
values.desc: For normal direction boxes, the right edge of the last child is placed at the right side, with all extra space placed before the first child. For reverse direction boxes, the left edge of the first child is placed at the left side, with all extra space placed after the last child.

values.name: justify
values.desc: The space is divided evenly in-between each child, with none of the extra space placed before the first child or after the last child. If there is only one child, treat the pack value as if it were start.

values.name: start
values.desc: For normal direction boxes, the left edge of the first child is placed at the left side, with all extra space placed after the last child. For reverse direction boxes, the right edge of the last child is placed at the right side, with all extra space placed before the first child.

-webkit-box-reflect.name: -webkit-box-reflect
-webkit-box-reflect.desc: Defines a reflection of a border box.

values.name: above
values.desc: The reflection appears above the border box.

values.name: below
values.desc: The reflection appears below the border box.

values.name: left
values.desc: The reflection appears to the left of the border box.

values.name: right
values.desc: The reflection appears to the right of the border box.

values.name: above, below, right, left
values.desc: Are keywords indicating in which direction the reflection is to happen.

-webkit-break-after.name: -webkit-break-after
-webkit-break-after.desc: Describes the page/column break behavior before the generated box.

values.name: always
values.desc: Always force a page break before/after the generated box.

values.name: auto
values.desc: Neither force nor forbid a page/column break before/after the generated box.

values.name: avoid
values.desc: Avoid a page/column break before/after the generated box.

values.name: avoid-column
values.desc: Avoid a column break before/after the generated box.

values.name: avoid-page
values.desc: Avoid a page break before/after the generated box.

values.name: column
values.desc: Always force a column break before/after the generated box.

values.name: left
values.desc: Force one or two page breaks before/after the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a left page.

values.name: page
values.desc: Always force a page break before/after the generated box.

values.name: right
values.desc: Force one or two page breaks before/after the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a right page.

-webkit-break-before.name: -webkit-break-before
-webkit-break-before.desc: Describes the page/column break behavior before the generated box.

values.name: always
values.desc: Always force a page break before/after the generated box.

values.name: auto
values.desc: Neither force nor forbid a page/column break before/after the generated box.

values.name: avoid
values.desc: Avoid a page/column break before/after the generated box.

values.name: avoid-column
values.desc: Avoid a column break before/after the generated box.

values.name: avoid-page
values.desc: Avoid a page break before/after the generated box.

values.name: column
values.desc: Always force a column break before/after the generated box.

values.name: left
values.desc: Force one or two page breaks before/after the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a left page.

values.name: page
values.desc: Always force a page break before/after the generated box.

values.name: right
values.desc: Force one or two page breaks before/after the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a right page.

-webkit-break-inside.name: -webkit-break-inside
-webkit-break-inside.desc: Describes the page/column break behavior inside the generated box.

values.name: auto
values.desc: Neither force nor forbid a page/column break inside the generated box.

values.name: avoid
values.desc: Avoid a page/column break inside the generated box.

values.name: avoid-column
values.desc: Avoid a column break inside the generated box.

values.name: avoid-page
values.desc: Avoid a page break inside the generated box.

-webkit-column-break-after.name: -webkit-column-break-after
-webkit-column-break-after.desc: Describes the page/column break behavior before the generated box.

values.name: always
values.desc: Always force a page break before/after the generated box.

values.name: auto
values.desc: Neither force nor forbid a page/column break before/after the generated box.

values.name: avoid
values.desc: Avoid a page/column break before/after the generated box.

values.name: avoid-column
values.desc: Avoid a column break before/after the generated box.

values.name: avoid-page
values.desc: Avoid a page break before/after the generated box.

values.name: column
values.desc: Always force a column break before/after the generated box.

values.name: left
values.desc: Force one or two page breaks before/after the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a left page.

values.name: page
values.desc: Always force a page break before/after the generated box.

values.name: right
values.desc: Force one or two page breaks before/after the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a right page.

-webkit-column-break-before.name: -webkit-column-break-before
-webkit-column-break-before.desc: Describes the page/column break behavior before the generated box.

values.name: always
values.desc: Always force a page break before/after the generated box.

values.name: auto
values.desc: Neither force nor forbid a page/column break before/after the generated box.

values.name: avoid
values.desc: Avoid a page/column break before/after the generated box.

values.name: avoid-column
values.desc: Avoid a column break before/after the generated box.

values.name: avoid-page
values.desc: Avoid a page break before/after the generated box.

values.name: column
values.desc: Always force a column break before/after the generated box.

values.name: left
values.desc: Force one or two page breaks before/after the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a left page.

values.name: page
values.desc: Always force a page break before/after the generated box.

values.name: right
values.desc: Force one or two page breaks before/after the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a right page.

-webkit-column-break-inside.name: -webkit-column-break-inside
-webkit-column-break-inside.desc: Describes the page/column break behavior inside the generated box.

values.name: auto
values.desc: Neither force nor forbid a page/column break inside the generated box.

values.name: avoid
values.desc: Avoid a page/column break inside the generated box.

values.name: avoid-column
values.desc: Avoid a column break inside the generated box.

values.name: avoid-page
values.desc: Avoid a page break inside the generated box.

-webkit-column-count.name: -webkit-column-count
-webkit-column-count.desc: Describes the optimal number of columns into which the content of the element will be flowed.

values.name: auto
values.desc: Determines the number of columns by the 'column-width' property and the element width.

-webkit-column-gap.name: -webkit-column-gap
-webkit-column-gap.desc: Sets the gap between columns. If there is a column rule between columns, it will appear in the middle of the gap.

values.name: normal
values.desc: User agent specific and typically equivalent to 1em.

-webkit-column-rule.name: -webkit-column-rule
-webkit-column-rule.desc: This property is a shorthand for setting 'column-rule-width', 'column-rule-style', and 'column-rule-color' at the same place in the style sheet. Omitted values are set to their initial values.

-webkit-column-rule-color.name: -webkit-column-rule-color
-webkit-column-rule-color.desc: Sets the color of the column rule

-webkit-column-rule-style.name: -webkit-column-rule-style
-webkit-column-rule-style.desc: Sets the style of the rule between columns of an element.

-webkit-column-rule-width.name: -webkit-column-rule-width
-webkit-column-rule-width.desc: Sets the width of the rule between columns. Negative values are not allowed.

-webkit-columns.name: -webkit-columns
-webkit-columns.desc: A shorthand property which sets both 'column-width' and 'column-count'.

values.name: auto
values.desc: The width depends on the values of other properties.

-webkit-column-span.name: -webkit-column-span
-webkit-column-span.desc: Describes the page/column break behavior after the generated box.

values.name: all
values.desc: The element spans across all columns. Content in the normal flow that appears before the element is automatically balanced across all columns before the element appear.

values.name: none
values.desc: The element does not span multiple columns.

-webkit-column-width.name: -webkit-column-width
-webkit-column-width.desc: This property describes the width of columns in multicol elements.

values.name: auto
values.desc: The width depends on the values of other properties.

-webkit-filter.name: -webkit-filter
-webkit-filter.desc: Processes an element’s rendering before it is displayed in the document, by applying one or more filter effects.

values.name: none
values.desc: No filter effects are applied.

values.name: url()
values.desc: A filter reference to a <filter> element.

-webkit-flow-from.name: -webkit-flow-from
-webkit-flow-from.desc: Makes a block container a region and associates it with a named flow.

values.name: none
values.desc: The block container is not a CSS Region.

-webkit-flow-into.name: -webkit-flow-into
-webkit-flow-into.desc: Places an element or its contents into a named flow.

values.name: none
values.desc: The element is not moved to a named flow and normal CSS processing takes place.

-webkit-font-feature-settings.name: -webkit-font-feature-settings
-webkit-font-feature-settings.desc: This property provides low-level control over OpenType font features. It is intended as a way of providing access to font features that are not widely used but are needed for a particular use case.

values.name: normal
values.desc: No change in glyph substitution or positioning occurs.

-webkit-hyphens.name: -webkit-hyphens
-webkit-hyphens.desc: Controls whether hyphenation is allowed to create more break opportunities within a line of text.

values.name: auto
values.desc: Conditional hyphenation characters inside a word, if present, take priority over automatic resources when determining hyphenation points within the word.

values.name: none
values.desc: Words are not broken at line breaks, even if characters inside the word suggest line break points.

-webkit-line-break.name: -webkit-line-break
-webkit-line-break.desc: Specifies line-breaking rules for CJK (Chinese, Japanese, and Korean) text.

-webkit-mask-clip.name: -webkit-mask-clip
-webkit-mask-clip.desc: Determines the mask painting area, which determines the area that is affected by the mask.

values.name: content-box
values.desc: The painted content is clipped to the content box.

values.name: padding-box
values.desc: The painted content is clipped to the padding box.

values.name: border-box
values.desc: The painted content is clipped to the border box.

values.name: margin-box
values.desc: The painted content is clipped to the margin box.

values.name: fill-box
values.desc: The painted content is clipped to the object bounding box.

values.name: stroke-box
values.desc: The painted content is clipped to the stroke bounding box.

values.name: view-box
values.desc: Uses the nearest SVG viewport as reference box. If a viewBox attribute is specified for the element creating the SVG viewport, the reference box is positioned at the origin of the coordinate system established by the viewBox attribute and the dimension of the reference box is set to the width and height values of the viewBox attribute.

values.name: no-clip
values.desc: The painted content is not clipped.

values.name: border
values.desc: This keyword behaves the same as border-box.

values.name: padding
values.desc: This keyword behaves the same as padding-box.

values.name: content
values.desc: This keyword behaves the same as content-box.

values.name: text
values.desc: This keyword clips the mask image to the text of the element.

-webkit-mask-image.name: -webkit-mask-image
-webkit-mask-image.desc: Sets the mask layer image of an element.

values.name: none
values.desc: Counts as a transparent black image layer.

values.name: url()
values.desc: Reference to a <mask element or to a CSS image.

values.name: content-box
values.desc: The position is relative to the content box.

values.name: padding-box
values.desc: The position is relative to the padding box. For single boxes 0 0 is the upper left corner of the padding edge, 100% 100% is the lower right corner.

values.name: border-box
values.desc: The position is relative to the border box.

values.name: margin-box
values.desc: The position is relative to the margin box.

values.name: fill-box
values.desc: The position is relative to the object bounding box.

values.name: stroke-box
values.desc: The position is relative to the stroke bounding box.

values.name: view-box
values.desc: Uses the nearest SVG viewport as reference box. If a viewBox attribute is specified for the element creating the SVG viewport, the reference box is positioned at the origin of the coordinate system established by the viewBox attribute and the dimension of the reference box is set to the width and height values of the viewBox attribute.

values.name: content
values.desc: Same as content-box.

values.name: padding
values.desc: Same as padding-box.

values.name: border
values.desc: Same as border-box.

-webkit-mask-repeat.name: -webkit-mask-repeat
-webkit-mask-repeat.desc: Specifies how mask layer images are tiled after they have been sized and positioned.

-webkit-mask-size.name: -webkit-mask-size
-webkit-mask-size.desc: Specifies the size of the mask layer images.

values.name: auto
values.desc: Resolved by using the image’s intrinsic ratio and the size of the other dimension, or failing that, using the image’s intrinsic size, or failing that, treating it as 100%.

values.name: contain
values.desc: Scale the image, while preserving its intrinsic aspect ratio (if any), to the largest size such that both its width and its height can fit inside the background positioning area.

values.name: cover
values.desc: Scale the image, while preserving its intrinsic aspect ratio (if any), to the smallest size such that both its width and its height can completely cover the background positioning area.

-webkit-nbsp-mode.name: -webkit-nbsp-mode
-webkit-nbsp-mode.desc: Defines the behavior of nonbreaking spaces within text.

-webkit-overflow-scrolling.name: -webkit-overflow-scrolling
-webkit-overflow-scrolling.desc: Specifies whether to use native-style scrolling in an overflow:scroll element.

-webkit-perspective.name: -webkit-perspective
-webkit-perspective.desc: Applies the same transform as the perspective(<number>) transform function, except that it applies only to the positioned or transformed children of the element, not to the transform on the element itself.

values.name: none
values.desc: No perspective transform is applied.

-webkit-perspective-origin.name: -webkit-perspective-origin
-webkit-perspective-origin.desc: Establishes the origin for the perspective property. It effectively sets the X and Y position at which the viewer appears to be looking at the children of the element.

-webkit-region-fragment.name: -webkit-region-fragment
-webkit-region-fragment.desc: The 'region-fragment' property controls the behavior of the last region associated with a named flow.

values.name: auto
values.desc: Content flows as it would in a regular content box.

-webkit-text-size-adjust.name: -webkit-text-size-adjust
-webkit-text-size-adjust.desc: Specifies a size adjustment for displaying text content in mobile browsers.

values.name: auto
values.desc: Renderers must use the default size adjustment when displaying on a small device.

values.name: none
values.desc: Renderers must not do size adjustment when displaying on a small device.

values.name: default
values.desc: The default callout is displayed.

-webkit-transform.name: -webkit-transform
-webkit-transform.desc: A two-dimensional transformation is applied to an element through the 'transform' property. This property contains a list of transform functions similar to those allowed by SVG.

-webkit-transform-origin.name: -webkit-transform-origin
-webkit-transform-origin.desc: Establishes the origin of transformation for an element.

-webkit-transform-origin-x.name: -webkit-transform-origin-x
-webkit-transform-origin-x.desc: The x coordinate of the origin for transforms applied to an element with respect to its border box.

-webkit-transform-origin-y.name: -webkit-transform-origin-y
-webkit-transform-origin-y.desc: The y coordinate of the origin for transforms applied to an element with respect to its border box.

-webkit-transform-origin-z.name: -webkit-transform-origin-z
-webkit-transform-origin-z.desc: The z coordinate of the origin for transforms applied to an element with respect to its border box.

-webkit-transform-style.name: -webkit-transform-style
-webkit-transform-style.desc: Defines how nested elements are rendered in 3D space.

-webkit-transition.name: -webkit-transition
-webkit-transition.desc: Shorthand property combines four of the transition properties into a single property.

values.name: all
values.desc: Every property that is able to undergo a transition will do so.

values.name: none
values.desc: No property will transition.

-webkit-transition-delay.name: -webkit-transition-delay
-webkit-transition-delay.desc: Defines when the transition will start. It allows a transition to begin execution some period of time from when it is applied.

-webkit-transition-duration.name: -webkit-transition-duration
-webkit-transition-duration.desc: Specifies how long the transition from the old value to the new value should take.

-webkit-transition-property.name: -webkit-transition-property
-webkit-transition-property.desc: Specifies the name of the CSS property to which the transition is applied.

values.name: all
values.desc: Every property that is able to undergo a transition will do so.

values.name: none
values.desc: No property will transition.

-webkit-transition-timing-function.name: -webkit-transition-timing-function
-webkit-transition-timing-function.desc: Describes how the intermediate values used during a transition will be calculated.

-webkit-user-modify.name: -webkit-user-modify
-webkit-user-modify.desc: Determines whether a user can edit the content of an element.

white-space.name: white-space
white-space.desc: Specifies how white-space inside an element is handled

values.name: normal
values.desc: Sets 'white-space-collapsing' to 'collapse' and 'text-wrap' to 'normal'.

values.name: nowrap
values.desc: Sets 'white-space-collapsing' to 'collapse' and 'text-wrap' to 'none'.

values.name: break-spaces
values.desc: The behavior is identical to that of pre-wrap, except that: Any sequence of preserved white space always takes up space, including at the end of the line.A line breaking opportunity exists after every preserved white space character, including between white space characters.Such preserved spaces take up space and do not hang, and thus affect the box’s intrinsic sizes (min-content size and max-content size).

widows.name: widows
widows.desc: Sets the minimum number of lines that must be left at the top of a page when a page break occurs inside an element

width.name: width
width.desc: Sets the width of an element

values.name: auto
values.desc: The width depends on the values of other properties.

values.name: max-content
values.desc: Use the max-content inline size or max-content block size, as appropriate to the writing mode.

values.name: min-content
values.desc: Use the min-content inline size or min-content block size, as appropriate to the writing mode.

values.name: fit-content(<length-percentage>)
values.desc: Uses the fit-content formula with the available space replaced by the specified argument, i.e. min(max-content, max(min-content, )).

will-change.name: will-change
will-change.desc: Provides a rendering hint to the user agent, stating what kinds of changes the author expects to perform on the element.

values.name: auto
values.desc: Expresses no particular intent.

values.name: contents
values.desc: Indicates that the author expects to animate or change something about the element’s contents in the near future.

word-break.name: word-break
word-break.desc: Specifies how words should break when reaching the end of a line

values.name: keep-all
values.desc: Block characters can no longer create implied break points.

values.name: normal
values.desc: Breaks non-CJK scripts according to their own rules.

values.name: break-word
values.desc: Has the same effect as word-break: normal and overflow-wrap: anywhere, regardless of the actual value of the overflow-wrap property.

word-spacing.name: word-spacing
word-spacing.desc: Increases or decreases the space between words in a text

values.name: normal
values.desc: No additional spacing is applied. Computes to zero.

word-wrap.name: word-wrap
word-wrap.desc: Allows long, unbreakable words to be broken and wrap to the next line

values.name: break-word
values.desc: An otherwise unbreakable sequence of characters may be broken at an arbitrary point if there are no otherwise-acceptable break points in the line.

values.name: normal
values.desc: Lines may break only at allowed break points.

values.name: anywhere
values.desc: To prevent overflow, an otherwise unbreakable string of characters — like a long word or URL — may be broken at any point if there are no otherwise-acceptable break points in the line. No hyphenation character is inserted at the break point. Soft wrap opportunities introduced by the word break are considered when calculating min-content intrinsic sizes.

writing-mode.name: writing-mode
writing-mode.desc: Specifies whether lines of text are laid out horizontally or vertically

z-index.name: z-index
z-index.desc: Sets the stack order of a positioned element

values.name: auto
values.desc: The stack level of the generated box in the current stacking context is 0. The box does not establish a new stacking context unless it is the root element.

zoom.name: zoom
zoom.desc: Non-standard. Specifies the magnification scale of the object. See 'transform: scale()' for a standards-based alternative.

values.name: reset
values.desc: Do not (de)magnify this element if the user applies non-pinch-based zooming (e.g. by pressing Ctrl-- or Ctrl++ keyboard shortcuts) to the document. Only supported by WebKit (and possibly Blink).
